text:
One of my two favorite Mexican places in the Chandler/Gilbert area. El Palacio in Gilbert and this are the two I go to most. I argue with myself over which I like more, each time I visit one of them..

Si Senor's has awesome green chili! To be honest, I haven't tried too many of their other items. I had their green chili there my first time a few years back, and when I stop in again I crave it so bad that I just end up ordering it again. I kind of alternate between their spicy green chili and their mild green. My dad likes their red too, I'm just not a fan of red in general. Sometimes their green mild is pretty hot, and sometimes their spicy green is so hot I have tears and snot running down my face (if you like heat, you know this is a good thing). Although when it is that bad, I usually cry all the way home and promise to never get the spicy again. Then a visit or two later I forget and order it again.

Salsas/bean dip/chips are always great. You get a round of sopapillas with honey free at the end of every meal. Love the food and I always have leftovers for later.

The one thing I don't like is it is always very crowded and with a busy place comes noise. Clearly many people also know how good it is, so if you don't get there early it can get loud and the seating is a little too close for my taste in general (but nothing obtrusive). But when it is less busy and you can sit back and enjoy and eat your green chili and cry spicy tears it is about as good as it gets.

This place lived up to all our expectations and more!! Great new Mexican cuisine, just like Richardson's in phx (sadly no longer around). Great sauces, lots of true new mexican style dishes to choose from..and the sopapillas are to die for with cinnamon, sugar AND honey OMG!!! This is what we've been searching for forever! 

The service was great! Our server, Yanai was really friendly, helpful, gave great suggestions and was very attentive!

I had the shredded beef chimi plate with the red sauce and that was,  hands down the best I have EVER had. It was perfectly and lightly seasoned which allows the natural flavor of the beef to come thru as the main attraction. The rice and beans tho are always the true test of a great mexican food restaurant...the verdict is awesome! 

Hubby had the #2 combo plate with all 3 red & green sauces on the side with both red & green chili con carne...everything was amazing!

We are looking forward to many more visits to explore the menu further!!

Lackluster food, service was passable make sure you read the menu a lot of fine print, I will not be returning. The staff thinks that their restaurant is so good the are arrogant, go to Garcia's instead way better food and better service. If you tell them about your experience there they don't care they just stare at you, the only thing this restaurant is good at is making diarrhea literally. This place used to be really really good going here reminds me of an episode of kitchen nightmares. If you stumble on this place keep driving don't waste your time or money.

I think I found my favorite mexican food restaurant.  I drive past several mexican food restaurants on my way to Si Señor, and I am happy to do so.  My test as to how much I like the food at a mexican restaurant is how well they do my favorite dish - cheese enchiladas, with rice and beans.  I find it shocking how many mexican food places do that dish poorly;  however, Si Señor did it great!  They serve a variety of salsa and bean dips with the chips, which I really like as well.  They give you a free Sopapilla (a deep fried pastry) at the end of your meal, which is a nice touch, and very delicious.  Interestingly, they catered a recent business event at my place of employment, so I had a chance to try the Chile Relleno a few days ago, which was also very good.  The restaurant is not glamorous, but comfortable and clean.  There is plenty of parking, and the staff seems nice and courteous.  Despite being there on a busy Friday evening, the food was still delivered quickly, and it was delicious!  I will definitely be back for more, and I don't plan on waiting very long before I do.  Please give them a try if you are in the mood for good mexican food.    By the way, it is New Mexican food, rather than Sonoran mexican food, so know that going in - I don't even really know the difference, but that is what they tell me.  I do know that I like it though, and I hope you enjoy it as much as I do!

Update:  I have now been back several times, and they have not disappointed me.  Their tacos are very good, and they make them just the way I like.  This is definitely my go-to mexican food restaurant.  If you haven't been, you owe it to yourself to give them a try.

I moved to Phoenix from las cruces nm . Here in Phoenix the Mexican cuisine is way different hard to find good food . I found out later we had si senor in chandler so had to drive the 40 minutes from westside of town to chandler . Was way worth it good taste the same or maybe even better then original location in cruces . Glad si senor opened in chandler will definitely be driving here at Least twice a week . Good customer service and clean restraunt
Green chilly burrito plate is awesome and you can ask for extra hot green chilly. Best green chilly I've had in AZ so far. Waitress was quick and attentive. Great job Si Senor.

Unfortunately I have to downgrade si Senor. The past 3 or 4 times ordering from there, they have either refused, or given pushback when we ask for vegetarian tacos (beans instead of meat). I don't understand why they make such a big deal out of this substitution?
If they offered calabacitas (grilled vegetables) this would improve the menu for me. For now, we'll be thinking twice about ordering from here knowing they are going to hassle us for making substitutions :(

I went here because the reviews were good but I was very disappointment. The atmosphere and the staff were very nice which is where the two stars comes from. However, the food was very bland and I thought it was overpriced. This place was a disgrace for a state that is known for their Mexican food.

I LOVE this place...  Here again for the lunch specials with the boyfriend and daughter... We get the green chili burritos and its always awesome.... Been coming for a while and its been ***** (5 Stars) every time.. Its worth the drive and price.

Their chips and salsa comes with a great variety of dips. Green salsa, red salsa, beans, and jalapeño sour cream. Our server Patricia was very polite. Plus the sopapillas are a great ending to a visit

This was my number 1 choice for dinner. I loved it. I raved to clients and friends, took out of town friends there, went there for special occasions......And then went back today.... my favorite meal... my ONLY meal (because I loved it so so much) is gone from the menu.  The green chili plate with beef (most restaurants serve with pork) has now been switched to pork. Not a fan so unfortunately I left empty handed. I literally cried. My husband likes a lot of stuff there so I'm sure their other food is delicious but I won't be back. My search will have to resume again for an amazingly tender beef green chili plate.

It's very hard to understand why this place gets good reviews. I've eaten here twice in the last year, and have actually been very disappointed both times. I was dragged along with work mates - not my choice.
If this makes me sound like a food snob then so be it, but I guess I have higher expectations than the other diners.
The first time I ate here, the metal plate they serve food on had dried food that made it look like the plate had not been washed properly. The second time the beans were hard and dry around the edge which made it look like they had been sitting there long before the tacos were added. Whichever explanation is the right one, it's VERY BAD to see dried food on your plate.
When I ate there yesterday the smell of backed up sewer as I approached the bathrooms was pretty bad.
Overall, a terrible dining experience and not cheap either - $10.50 for 3 chicken tacos. Sure it's not expensive, but I expect better quality for that price.

There are way better Mexican restaurants.

When you're from New Mexico and missing home, this is the place to go! Delicious bean dips, and excellent price on happy hour margaritas. Enchiladas were amazing, and the red and green chili were both so good!!

My husband and I are AZ natives....so we know (and love) us some good Mexican food.  After moving to Chandler, we looked high and low for a great new Mexican spot....to no avail...until.... Si Senor!  

The food gets 5/5 stars.  But beware: this is not the spot for the faint of tongue.  You MUST like it HOT.  Like sweat-runs-out-of-your-eyes hot.  Like, oh-my-God-I'm-going-to-poop-FIRE hot.  Like wow-this-is-spicy (you get the picture) hot.  

The service varies.  Some of the servers are better than others.  Let me put it simply: you do not go for the service.  The food is what keeps us coming back (chips for 4 types of dip and free sopapillas at the end of every meal- HELLO)!  

And the restaurant itself isn't the most beautiful.  But I'm okay with that.  The prices are great, the food is outta this world, and I'm addicted.  

Si Senor is the bees-knees.  Go.  The food never disappoints.

I am from New Mexico and the original Si Senor is located in Las Cruces NM, and so when I moved here and found out that the same owners also have a Si Senor in Chandler I was pumped, by the way other restaurants claim they are New Mexican style food they are not they are wannabes.

So if you want true New Mexican food this is the place, price wise it is great you get alot of food for pretty cheap.  You get chips and 4 dips to start, the main course and to top it off sopillas for free.  Anything is great on the menu, i love the burrito plate, tasting it brings me back to new mexico.  Also if you love one of the dips you could buy some to take home, the white chili dip is the best dip!

First time visit, place packed with holiday crowds, not too long of wait. Best red and green pork Chilli I have had in years. Sides ordinary but only so much you can do with rice and beans, home made chips and sauces also very tasty.
Makes me want to start planning trip to New Mexico.

If you want great New Mexico Mexican food...This is the place. Growing up in New Mexico it was hard fro me to get used to the blah Sonoran Mexican food that is served here. The chips and salsa is a meal by itself. Everyone I have brought there loves it and wants to come back. It is New Mexico style so be careful, it's not for the average white folks!!!

Ordered my favorite plate here. Combo number 1. Always tastes great and it is very good quality food.  Service was helpful and extremely quick on getting the food out to you. A bit disappointed on the regular menu prices. Seems they have went up since I first started going here. Also the sopapillas are great after dinner snacks.
Great food. Definitely reminds me of New Mexico! Green Chile is very spicy.

First off I am from Las Cruces, NM where the original Si Senor is located and the funny thing is, I'm not a fan of that location. I much prefer the location in Chandler. It might be because I haven't found another New Mexican restaurant yet that satisfies my need for enchiladas or gorditas in this area, although I haven't tried looking either. Si Senor pretty much does it for me. The portions are huge so beware. My usual order is the red cheese enchiladas, the chile isn't too hot and has good flavor. The ground beef and shredded beef tacos are excellent. Best part is the sopapillas at the end of the meal, either plain or dusted with cinnamon sugar.

One thing I miss is my usual 23 oz mug of Dos Equis that the LC location has. I could get a bottle but there's something about a giant frosty glass!

Terrible sanitary condition. Daughters burrito had a bit off nail in it and the General Manager had the nerve to say an I quote "I'm not entirely sure the nail is ours". Unbelievable. I will never go to a Dos Gringos again. I will encourage others to do the same!

I have been a fan of Si Senor since visiting the Deming NM location a few years back. (If you are out that way I highly recommend it!)

I have been to the Chandler location several times and the food can be hit or miss. Sometimes the flavors are great, and other times just ok. Service is always excellent and the staff are very friendly. 

They always bring out a plate of warm chips and 4 different salsas. Nice!

This past visit (on a Thursday) we ordered the chicken enchiladas (with green salsa) and the chicken fajitas. The food was served hot. The enchiladas, usually smothered with salsa were a little dry and only had a little of their delicious sauce, somewhat lacking in flavor. The fajitas were also lacking in flavor. Maybe a different cook? 

The sopapillas which we always look forward to were warm, but parts of them were hard and crunchy.

I think it was an off night for them.

I rate the food as 3.5 star, and the service 4 star, so overall a 4 star rating.

Mediocre with bad service! The green chilies sauce is good but doesn't over come the flavorless chicken or beef. They start you off with chips and a bunch of different salsas. That is truly the highlight. As far as service I was passed in line by three patrons I was clearly ahead of.  Our server was completely disengaged. All the  food and dirty plates are hauled back and forth on the same cart.

Try this restaurant! I moved to AZ 5 years ago and this is still my favorite Mexican restaurant.  Each meal comes with complimentary chips and 4 types of salsa dips. I have never had a bad  thing on the menu. The staff is nice and the atmosphere is great!!

Stopped for Sunday lunch here -- first timers. 

The place was super busy, but the service was still excellent. 

They bring chips with four salsa options on the table to start with. All four were tasty. It is difficult to stop eating them so... leave room for you HUGE plate of food! 

I ordered one of the combination plates that included taco, rilleno, enchilada, and tamale.  The relleno is delicious!  The taco and enchilada were good, tamale was seasoned well, just spicy enough.  Also included the typical rice and beans. 

The plate itself is a large amount of food, so be prepared for some good leftovers. And when you choose your salsa (red or green), and they ask you mild or hot, be prepared for the "hot" to be hot (the kind of hot that works like a slow burn and creeps up on you and suddenly you realize the stuff is burning the inside of your ears... that kind of hot, which I like as long as it doesn't overpower the flavor of the salsa, which in this case, it did not).  Good balance of hot and savory on the salsas. 

They end the meal with a warm sopaipilla, regular or cinnamon & sugar.

Ambience is average, but a good stop for Mexican food to "hit the spot."

Just went here for lunch with the shop. I liked the provided chips and salsa. The chips were warm and seemed home-made. They gave us a warm green chili salsa, cold red salsa, warm bean dip with a meaty ham type flavor, and a white sour cream based cold dip. I love creamy dips so I mostly ate the white one. Our server helped us immediately, which is important when your entire shop is out to lunch (which for us was only 4 people). She brought us drinks and asked to take our order right away. We mostly ordered from the lunch special menu and my Chicken Quesadilla with green chiles was only like $6-7. After eating all those yummy chips I was only able to eat 3 out of 8 of the slices! I have a ton of leftovers.  As an added bonus, they give you a free sopapia at the end. It was fresh and so yummy. I would definitely go here more often if it wasn't so far from our shop.

My family and I went for lunch this weekend and it was fantastic. To start the chips came with four different dips that all had such great flavors: bean, green chile, salsa and a sour cream/ chile combo. 
  I had the chicken burrito combo with the hatch chile sauce, it was really good.

My family and I love this place. It's very nice inside and their portions are good and the quality is excellent. Service is outstanding, which is unusual around here. The sopapillas are a nice touch after the meal. I'd highly recommend Si Senor to anyone.
Absolutely best New Mexican meal in S.E. metri area. Very fresh ingredients, perfect sauces and always cooked just right. Great sopapillas come with every meal.

Delicious chips and salsa, delicious food and yummy sopapillas! My husband and I drive to Phoenix just to go to Si Senor. The service is always great and we always leave happy! We always order the number 1 combination and number 2 and it's plenty of food.

Outstanding!  Very authentic New Mexico style food.  The 4 dips are perfect start to your meal.  My cheese enchiladas had the best flavor and the chili rellano breading was perfect.  New " Go To" Mexican restaurant.

This was great Mexican food at a fair price.  They actually brought a good level of spice (I asked for the "hot" green hatch sauce and it delivered).  Nothing super unique that we ordered during this particular lunch visit, sticking with combo plates, but I will definitely try some of their specialties on my next visit.

This place is awful!   Disgustingly dirty!!! Used to be a regular customer until I had fruit flies in my food and the managers refused to take it off my bill even though I hadn't even taken a bite. Dirty and poor management and customer service!!

This has to be the best New Mexico-style restaurant in the Valley.  My family and I come here often, and I always try to talk friends into coming with me.  Their red and green chili come in mild or hot.  If you choose hot, please be prepared for HOT.  They only use Hatch chilis, so anything with chili on it is going to have lots of delicious Hatch chili flavor.  My favorite is either the rellenos or the stuffed sopapillas--sopapillas stuffed with your choice of ground beef, shredded beef, or chicken, covered in your choice of red or green sauce and cheese.  I usually go with the delicious marinated chicken and hot green sauce.  Lots of other commenters also commented on the chips and salsa, and those reviewers didn't lie!  The chips and salsa are great!  You could practically just fill up on the chips and salsa and skip the rest of the meal, it is that good!

The service is always quick and the waiters/waitresses are friendly and knowledgeable.  Also, they have a full bar and amazing margaritas.  The food always tastes fresh, you'll never feel like you're getting yesterday's beans and rice.  If you're tired of Manuel's, Serrano's, or Garcia's, definitely give Si Senor a try.  I have NEVER had a bad experience there.
New Mexican food at its finest. I'm a regular here and will continue to be. Great service and awesome happy hour.

I determine whether I like a Mexican restaurant based on two things, the kind of Mexican beer on draft and, chile rellenos. 
By far my favorite Chile Relleno dish I've had.
This place is great. 
I love the variety of choices I get to dip my chips in!
Even the beans and rice are good!!!
Just say Si.
So so food. Had the #1 combo platter and all the different dishes tasted the same. Service was slow like they were short staffed. Our search for a good sit down Mexican restaurant continues....

NMSU alum, Abq resident for the past 17 years - recently moved here to the valley...   I am spoiled by the above average Mexican restaurants in "the 505/575"...  If I could only find one or two of those restaurants here in the Phoenix metro, I would be one happy hombre.  Guess what.?  Si Señor has two locations - Las Cruces and Chandler.!  Southern NM food - CHECK.!!

Food came out a bit on the salty side for me (chx stuffed sopas, red + green "Christmas" on top.. Beans and rice..). but was otherwise VERY tasty.  I informed our waitress to reign in the salter a bit - I don't think she understood me though.....

The Hatch green chile is on point.  I cannot emphasize that enough .!!!!   I'm stoked to have a little bit of home 15 minutes away, instead of 5 hours.  :)

Oh yeah - I could eat a bowl of the green chile salsa served with the chips.....  Loved it.!

Wife had the beef flautas, kiddos rocked their favorites - bean and cheese burritos...  Everyone was happy.  Good food, decent margaritas.   Now if only I could convince them to serve RO water instead of straight from the tap, I would say this place is one star shy of Yelp! perfection.  Actually - compared to some of the other "New Mexican" restaurants we've tried here, it should be six stars...but I digress...

Service was 15% gratuity territory- average.

Excellent food and service (read the flow of beer was satisfyingly rapid) overall, the green salsa was wonderfully balanced providing a nice amount of heat with an excellent amount of taste. Unfortunately, I was slightly disappointed in my gorditas as the chicken was slightly dry but otherwise the rice and beans were definitely above par. Unlike some Mexican or New Mexican restaurants I was pretty pleased with the freshness of the ingredients, I didn't see brown lettuce or greenish tomatoes, and while the chicken was disappointing the rest of our dining party was greatly pleased. I will definitely go back to take a stab at the enchiladas or something else that impressed everyone else.
Good Mexican food, I come here often to have tried most things. Fast, and good food.

They had good service and good prices. However I was not a huge fan of their food. It is really spicy (and I usually go to Mexican restaurants) and I want all that impressed with the quality. Though if you like super spicy and a lot of sauce this would be a good fit for you.

I really liked this place. The food was good. 
FREE SOPAPILLAS!! YAY! YAY!

This is actually the best New Mexican food in the valley.

Not sure why this place has 4 stars.  I will say the server was friendly and attentive, but the food wasn't memorable.  The chips were stale and the margaritas were too sweet.  My mom ordered the flautas and they were pretty bland.  My husband and I split the chimichanga and it wasn't bad, but not one I would crave in the future.  We likely won't be back as there are other outstanding places in the Valley I would choose.

Average. Nothing to write home about. The chicken was plan, it felt like they just boiled the chicken in water and then shred it. The taco shell was really oily. First time there and it would be the last.
Perfection on a plate!!! Service, food, presentation, and quality are unmatched. Do it!!! You will thank me later...especially when you start sweating from how hot the green chile is! Enjoy!
They have four types of dipping sauces with the chips they serve and they are all fantastic! If you want more then you gotta pay extra but it is worth it. The enchiladas are the best!

Two of us stopped there based on friends who eat there a lot. We are not big fans of Mexican food, but it was good. They start serving lunch at 10:30, so that was good. The entrees come with a swweet Sopaipilla. Though tasty, I thought there was too much dough. The same for my Flauta, a little too chewey. The presentation of the tortilla chips and dip included 4 choices, the green being quite spicy. I also thought the chips could have been lighter.
The best New Mexico style food in the Valley. I drive 37 miles to get here because it so good. I love the enchilada plate. I get it flat, shredded beef, Hatch green chili, and a fried egg on top.

I have been visiting my mom for 6 years and she finally took me here.  The food was so good I made everyone go back the next day.  

Spicy, crunchy, melty was what I was craving in my pregnancy and this was the cure.  I had a combo plate with spicy red sauce.  It was amazing, I almost cried it was so good.  The enchilada and burrito were perfect.  The chili con carne was delicious.  I am counting the days until I am back in AZ and can go back.  

I have eaten at many mexican restaurants when I visit and this is my favorite.

Si Senor used to be family favorite. Haven't been there in almost three years up until today. We were disappointed at how much the quality in service and the quantity of food has declined with increased prices. Not sure if management has changed, but they now charge for every little thing. My mom ordered an iced tea that tasted like dirty dish water and asked for something else to drink. She was charged for a another refillable soft drink instead of changing it out complimentary. My brothers refried beans had a metal taste. When reporting concerns to management all they said was "sorry". We will never go back!!! If I did not have to give at least 1 star, I wouldn't but instead give negative stars. The only reason they are getting 1 star is for the sopa which is the only thing going for them.

Absolutely the best Mexican restaurant! I am from NM where this restaurant is based out of. It's just as good. The green chile is hot and enchiladas are fantastic. I always get the green chile cheese enchiladas.

Surely not a place I will be dying to go to again.

Server was friendly.. but terrible.  Took forever to get chips and salsa, took a long time for her to take our drink order, she charged me an extra buck for my beer, forgot to bring out my water, my girlfriends diet coke remained empty for most of the meal, and forgot my leftover box until being reminded a few times.  Wasn't that busy... maybe just an off night for her.

Really can't scratch off a place due to a miss on service.  So, onto the food.  So completely overpriced for just your standard Mexican fare.  I had the green chile con carne which was good, but around $9.00 bucks for a small bowl is so completely overpriced.  They give you one serving of chips and then want to charge $3.00 for your second serving.  We didn't finish through our first batch of chips but I still found it a bit tacky.  Couple that with the fact that they charge you $3.00 for plate splitting.  Everywhere you turn on the menu it's telling you, extra charge for this, extra for that, limited refills, no substitutions.  You'd almost get the impression they really don't want you there.  My girlfriend got an enchilada plate which she said was decent, but not fantastic (especially for the price).


I'm sure there are better options in the area to find.
Yum! Delicious dips. Good portions and solid Mexican food. Great for families. No complaints- would definitely return!
So amazing!! Reminds me of the awesome Mexican food I have in Central California :)))

I haven't found a Mexican restaurant that compares yet. 

Salsas are hot, so be sure you have your water before you indulge. My favorite is the hot green, but they offer 4 varieties of salsas. 

The shredded beef is good. The chicken is always good - all white meat! The ground beef is yummy too, but not my first choice. 

My favorites are the enchiladas, the taco salad and also the tacos. 

A weekly craving! And the best happy hour around, as it is daily from the late afternoon until 7pm.

My absolute favorite New Mexico style food restaurant. My only complaint is I live in Glendale and this place is located in Chandler. Really far to drive to get my favorite  food. Please consider opening  on the west side on Bell Rd. in fact, there are several vacant restaurant buildings calling your name. Your flat enchiladas are the best and I'm craving your sopapillas. People in Chandler and Mesa, try this place!
45 min wait for food after we placed our order. Food was cold and extremely dry. Also had to move our own chairs and get silver wear for ourselves

We have been coming here for years with great food and great service.  But today you guys really dropped the ball.  My order came out wrong and my wife was done eating before my new plate ever made it to my table.

I'm a fan!  Highly recommended!

Si Senor is a bit of a drive for me but well worth it.  I love HOT and spicy food and Si Senor delivers!

They offer a lunch-time special and I usually get the burrito plate (with green chili and ground beef) which comes with beans and rice for a very reasonable price.

Everything is mouthwateringly (is that a word?) good.  And you get a generous supply of chips with two salsas, bean dip and a tasty cheesy dip.

Bonus points:  You never have to ask for a drink refill!  As soon as your glass starts to get to the bottom...you are brought a new one.

Recently, at the end of my meal I was stuffed and my server reminded me that I still had a free sopapilla.

I shouldn't have...but......................

Wow...it was a tasty meal indeed!  : )

Had the pork green chili plate. It was more a rice and bean plate. The portion of pork and chili was pathetic. I asked the waiter if it looked right and he said yes. There were only 6 tiny pieces of pork.

I am totally in love with this place! It is soooo good. I usually just get a shredded beef chimi, with red sauce and it is very good. 

besides that, I HATE leftovers, but whenever I bring home leftovers from si senior, i always eat it. Their food is still good the second day. 

They also have sopapillas- either regular or cinnamon.  and free chips, with 4 different kinds of dips. I am not a big dip person, but when I took my dad here he loved it! 

The service is also good. :)
What can i say about si senor.....very good new Mexican style food.... very good red chile sauce... very good green chile sauce and superb sapapillas.

After reading all the rave reviews here on yelp* I just had to try the chips and 4 dips. I liked them all especially the sour cream one with more than a hint of hot, as a matter of fact all 4 were a bit spicey which is something for me since I do like spicey food. Staff was friendly and polite and quick on the refills but was taken aback when I saw the sign that said  "We give only one extra napkin per a customer" kinda tripped me out considering they charge 8.95 for guacamole and chips...not cool. I had the Chimichanga plate and my wife had the Cheese Enchiladas both were great and filling, had to stop and make room for the Sopapias and honey. Yeah I'd eat here again. Oh yeah forgot the wife finished everthing off with a Top Shelf Margarita and she said it was good, they didn't skimp on the Tequila.

This place is great ! Not familiar with this area I pulled it up on Yelp . Wait staff was fantastic, gave us suggestions. Both our lunches were plenty of food. Lunch special came with a generous chip basket 4 dipping sauces, beverage , entree, and sopapilla s. All for $15, nice clean place. I highly recommend!

Had the enchilada plate. Both red and green chili sauces. The red tasted good. The green was OK. Wasn't the best but was better than most places I've tried here in phx metro area. Sopapillas were good, they come with the meal. Their not a desert like most Az Mexican restaurants, but honey does come with them. Overall good New Mexican food.
First time at this restaurant and it's delicious! New Mexican flare and spicy. Clean and had great service, food came out quick and they gave us chips and salsa(s) while we waited

Ate dinner here for the first time a couple of days ago. Combo dinner w/ green chilli.  No draft mex beers. 

OK food just not the kind of Mexican food I like. I like my corn chips covered with salt, hot and greasy, like they just came out of a boiling vat of lard. Theirs were the kind of generic chips you can get anywhere.  Rest of the food was average.

I lucked out and got a very good waitress who checked on my table often. 

The atmosphere was kinda of weird. The painted celling made me think of Aphrodite's palace in "my big fat Greek wedding". 

Anyway they got really busy about the time I was leaving so they are doing something right. Just not a place I will make a regular stop.

Great food, really like the green chile burger. ( I know, I order a burger from a Mexican food place, but it's awesome) Also, they bring sopapilla's (sic?) after your meal which are delicious. Service has a tendency to be slow, never got refills, but otherwise a good place to get your grub on.

We like Si Señor for lunch. I think what stands out to me is the little extras you get that I don't see other when going out to other similar places. For example the chips and salsa you get come with 4 kinds of dipping options. Chips are always fresh. The Taco and Enchilada lunch special is 6.95 with drink and a sopaipilla after your meal. Delicious. I really have been satisfied with the service and quality each time.

This restaurant was not a 4 by any means. I give it a 2. The salsa was nothing special. Our beers came out warm and one of the dishes was incorrect. After all this, they took $2 off instead of not charging for the beer and dish. The food was mediocre. I would not visit this place again.

If you are a green chile lover then this place is for you!!!  The food can be spicy but is wonderful.  When you drive up you might be a little unsure because of the location but give this place a try.  The staff is extremely hit or miss.  Some are good others are just plain horrible.  Unless you go for lunch it is a bit pricey.

I gave Yes Sir a try last night. Would I go there again?....si, senor. I got a take out order, enchilada style beef burro with the green sauce, and a couple of beef gorditas. I'm not sure if the real Mexicanos out there would approve of this place, but me being a god fearing Anglo Saxon of Irish ancestry I found it to be delicious. They even threw in some sopapillas free of charge,  probably because they liked my handsome face. Not sure if they do that for everyone. 

So if you're in the mood for some good Mexican food and you don't wanna spend a bunch of pesos n stuff, go down to si senor.

I can't even begin to to explain how good the food is here! We came a few weeks ago, and my boyfriend wouldn't stop asking when we were coming back. The food is HOT, so be prepared! At the beginning, you get chips with a side of beans, spicy sour cream, red salsa, and green chile salsa... so good! My boyfriend got the Green Chile Plate and it looked and smelled so good. I got the vegetarian plate that comes with a bean taco(totally vegetarian), a cheese enchilada, chile rellano, and rice and beans. You will ALWAYS take food home for leftovers. The service is friendly, they bring your food out on carts, which is kind of weird, but who cares. 

I would definitely recommend this place if you like spicy (New) Mexican food!
If you're looking for authentic New Mexico food this is the place!  I'm from Silver city New Mexico and I could never find Mexican food here in Arizona. A little piece of home :)
Fast and nice service, great lunch special prices, quality of food is top notch. Green sauce is the best I've had in Arizona. A must-try!

Here's how they rate on the 3 items any review needs:

Price:  you'll spend more than you'd expect
Service:  they seem to avoid coming around
Taste:  excellent

My guess is that this place has a dedicated and proud-of-his-work chef, who is surrounded by a lackluster wait staff that looks at the clock and counts down the time that they get to leave.  I bet you'll see them in gossip sessions in the hallways and service areas.

Good Luck.

WONDERFUL! GO HERE! Amazing authentic Mexican food, quick excellent service! We had to be in and out quickly and she completely catered to us in the short amount of time we had! Our server had at least 9 other tables that we saw, but you could never tell by her level of service. She was so friendly and full of great recommendations! Food was fast and Hot. Absolutely delicious! Chips were warm and fresh, salsas all spectacular! We will definitely be back asap!

My husband and I can't say enough about how much we love Si Senior. More authentic than any Mexican restaurant in the east valley. We often take our out of town company there when the want good Mexican food and when they're back in town again they ask yo go back. The four dips/salsa. Served with fresh chips are always a treat. Each meal includes with sopapias (?) which are hot and delicious. We recommend the green chile - our favorite!

This is by far the best real mexican food you can get in the valley area.  I used to live across the street from the original one in Las Cruces, NM and this one is exactly the same.

- Great attentive staff
- Food quality is consistent and excellent
- Excellent variety of salsa (and the fact they get their chiles from Hatch, NM)
- Very nice ambiance
- Always seated quickly and plenty of room
- Very reasonable pricing and the amount of food you get for it.  (Salsa = Free, Sopapillas = Free).  

Wish they had another location in north valley.  But it is always worth the trip..never been disappointed.  Keep it up guys!!

Unfortunately the good cooks must have been off tonight, because the food that I had was very different than what the other reviewers had. 

The chips and various salsas were the best part of the meal.  Knowing that this is a New Mexican restaurant I figured that the green chili pork was the way to go. I ordered the green chili pork combo with hot green chili sauce. I had to ask the server if I ordered the hot sauce e because it was so mild and bland. The server was not interested in the fact the food was bland (no salt and no spices were used in it). 

I will not be returning to this place and I would recommend that you not visit here either.

For what Si Senor is, kind of a combination New Mexican/Mexican restaurant, it's good. Not great, but good. If you have a strong need for a Mexican food "fix", Si Senor should fit the bill. I am from Las Cruces originally, home of lots of really good New Mexican restaurants making use of that famous Hatch chile. Based on these other places - Si Senor is in the middle of the pack. Here, it's pretty good. Nice to have the 4 types of salsa offered with chips as soon as you sit down. Always good service. You usually don't have to wait long for the food to appear - indicative of having a good assembly line in the kitchen, with the food in various stages of preparation. Try the stuffed sopapillas for something a little different. Make sure to ask for extra salsa though since they really don't add too much chile to them. Of course, their enchiladas are standard solid fare! We go pretty often!

New to Yelp, and the first review I made sure to make was on Si Senor.  If you are looking for authentic New Mexican food this is the place.  The mural on their wall of the Organ mtns says it all although most of their employees don't know nothing about the other restaurant in Las Cruces.  The dip trio and chips are so good make sure not to fill up on that alone.  When they say the hot green chili is HOT they mean it.  Hot and flavorfull.  I stick to the basics like enchiladas and tacos so I can't say much more about the rest of their menu.  Also save room for desert when you are treated to sopapillas - plain or with brown sugar!

Really enjoyed my meal and experience here. Had a Margarita and the Chicken Chimichanga, both were great. Service was perfect and the spicy green salsa was terrific. I've been back many, many times now and always consistently good.

We sat close to the wait station and it was very noisy. Our wait person did an amazing job, Disappointed that the food was so hot that you really couldn't taste the flavor of what you were eating. My sister who has eaten there numerous times said that she has never experienced that much spice. I will give it another try. It may just have been the green chile batch that was used for that particular day.
I go here for the Chile Con Carne, it's hot and every meal comes with chips & 4 different salsas, plus sopaipillas... What? No complaints here
Had their chili Colorado  burrito for lunch.  Excellent.   Can't beat the lunch deal.  Drink comes with meal.  Will definetly  go back!
AMAZING huge Portions great service and at a reasonable price I definitely recommend this place!

Huge fan of Mexican food huge fan of this place... I've gone there twice now first time during lunch hour service was excellent and if you get the lunch special you get desert along with it 
I had shredded chicken enchilladas with the red sauce I enjoyed the sauce it was perfect not sweet and not overerly spicy became and rice were delish food came fast and hot I loved it!

Best Mexican food in the valley!!!  They start you out with a great combination of chips and dips, 4 different kinds and all yum yum.  If you like it hot this is your place.  My favorite plate is Chicken Enchilada plate with Hatch New Mexican Chili.  The real deal.  Owner trucks the chili in from New Mexico.  Family business from New Mexico.  Best seating is in the center room under the sky and don't forget to have a Don Julio Margarita.  Save room for desert they serve you Sopapillas on the house at the end of your meal (AMAZING!) I've tasted many things on the menu, you can't go wrong.
Great New Mexican chilli! Best lunch specials around with friendly staff. Chips and 4 different salsas are to die for. The green chilli salsa was by far my favorite.

This place was fantastic!!!!!! We love our Mexican food and this really hit the spot.   Everything was really great.  Service was fast as well.  Our server Patricia didn't miss a beat.  We didn't wait for a thing.  Def 5 stars.
If you want green chile this is your spot! Be sure to ask for the hot green chile if you like it spicy. Great place for anyone who is a fan of New Mexico Mexican cuisine. Can't beat it!!

Good food.  My daughter and I like the Relleno.  The chicken chimi is STUFFED w/ chicken.

Don't know if they still charge for additional chips and salsa after the compliementary serving.  They give you 3 different salsas:  green, red and a sour cream with chilis.  Yum.
Moved from California about 3 years ago and finally found a good Mexican restaurant! Too bad the don't do breakfast or menudo.
I just had huevos rancheros with red and green chili, it was great! The only reason I only gave them a 4/5 is because I have only eaten there once.
Amazing. Best green chile con carne in town.

Awesome for foodserviceand atmosphere. Chips with 4 sauces, one better than the next! Oh, my! New Mexico heat - thank you hatch chiles! I'm not eating til Monday! Sopapillas like pillows of pure love with cinnamon on top. If you're smart, you'll get here. And you will become a regular.

We have been going to this place for about  15 years. The food reminds my home town in New Mexico.  The staff is super nice.  We can't forget Yolonda we have been going there so long she treats us like family.   Those hatch green chilies makes their dishes outstanding.  Not to say the least how about those sopapilllas with and without sugar.  This place is the best place New Mexican cuisine in Arizona. :)

My very close friend has been coming here for years. It's one of his family's favorite places for Mexican food. He lives half the year in Denver and half the year in downtown Phoenix. But he will drive all the way out here from Phoenix to get the food from Si Seonor.
So I finally got to join him for lunch at this restaurant.
Wow, what a great experience. The food is absolutely fantastic!!!
Delicious, Fresh, and reasonably priced. Such a good experience. But, go hungry  so you'll be able to enjoy at least a few bites of everything ,fantastic food. 
I got so much food that I had to take half home. That was a full meal in itself.
They bring you chips with a tray full of different types of salsa and bean dip that alone is a meal in itself.

The restaurant is very clean. The service was wonderful.
They are open Monday through Saturday from 10:30 AM to 9 PM. On Sunday they're open from 10:30 AM to 8 PM. Lots of parking in the lot. This place is so worth a try

Took the family here one night for Mexican food as opposed to any of the "chain" restaurants.  Kids enjoyed the atmosphere and the food.

Restaurant, was clean, service was good, food was tasty and sopadillas were enjoyed by all.  

Only detriment was the TV in the dining area, should be in the bar area only. 

Will definitely visit again.

I have been fortunate to have traveled quite a bit. I love Santa Fe and Taos and get back to those spots as much as possible. This restaurant has identical New Mexico cuisine flavor and preperation.  I had burritos. They have Hatch Chilies I am told are brought in from the farms in Hatch. I believe it! If you are in the mood for simple and delicious New Mexican cuisine this place is IT. Especially if you love Hatch chili!  Lunch crowd on a Tuesday was fierce. Service friendly and sweet.  Nice portions. Taking home leftovers! Prices reasonable. I will be back when I want to taste New Mexico, but cannot take the time to drive. Keep it up!
I am from New Mexico and this is the best New Mexico mexican food I have had here in AZ.

Never never liked Mexican food growing up, until my NM transplanted friend took me here.  No other joint has touched this place in my heart.

--Hatch green sauce, there is nothing like it...
--Chips and 4 dips and sauces, omg.
--Cheese enchilada plate (better than the chicken), chicken tacos or the flautas. omg x2.
--Sopapillas, omg omg omg.  It does not get better than this.

Any out of towner who wants to try (NM) Mexican food, I take them here!

Any day, any time I will devour some Si Senor! 
I always get their number one with green smoke and it is always on point always spicy and delicious!
Please open one in Gilbert!!!!!! Please you will succeed!

This is hands down the best New Mexican food in the valley!  As a New Mexican transplant, I was so excited to learn about this place.  They even have a picture of the Organ Mountains near Las Cruces - my college town- hanging in the lobby!  The thing anyone from New Mexico misses when they leave  is GREEN CHILE!  If you haven't tried it, I suggest a trip to Si Senor to give it a try- you'll be hooked!  It comes in the hot or mild variety and is so flavorful. I always order the big combo plate so I have left overs for the next day!
AMAZING! And I'm from New Mexico. I only wish that they would open for breakfast!

This restaurant is one of our favorites. Servixe is good. Their salsas are so yummy and the dishes are authentic  Mexican food, I like to order their enchiladas and my children loove their sopapillas with honey. We came here about once a month.

I'm from New Mexico, Hatch specifically. My grandparents live in Deming, where the OG Si Senor is and I've had countless meals there. I now live in Hawaii so I take any chance I can get to have New Mexican food. The place is much like the Las Cruces location, only not quite as fancy. The initial chips and salsa include 4 different types which is always a bonus. I had shredded beef gorditas and they were excellent and the beans of course were also. I'm not a big rice fan, I usually get double beans, and the rice here isn't special so I didn't eat it. When in doubt, order a combo.

I will be back every chance I get since our family is in the area. it's always a good taste of home.

Nice clean place, chips served with 4 dips, man I loved the sour cream jalapeño  dip the most, I ordered the 2 beef burritos with the Christmas salsa (Red and Green salsas) with beans and rice. Let me start by saying it has been a very long time since I had New Mexican cuisine, I used to live in Arizona many moons ago. All I can say is O.M.G. taste explosion,  man I forgot how different this is from Tex-Mex, the hatch red and green chile's were off the chart, and the sopapilla at the end to cool the heat off was a nice touch. Very fast service, we had a nice waitress served my sister and I well. My sister had the 3 enchilada diner with the red salsa, the plates here are huge, she could not finish, me I killed my plate, she agreed the food was excellent,  and scared down on the chips and dips (Bean dip, avocado dip, green salsa and sour cream) all were excellent,  I will come back here when I am in town again.
Super amazing service and loved my enchiladas! The salsa was smiley and not too hot which is always a nice treat. Not too much cilantro either.

Great salsas, loved the green chile, and bean dip.  The hot version of the green chile is HOT but really good.  All of the combination plates were good.  Enjoyed the chile relleno and enchiladas.  Wait time on a friday evening was about 25 min.  Nice place to take the family.  A bit over priced.  Service was nothing special.   I'm spoiled by all the great fast food mexican restaurants in the area.

Wow!  Best enchilada sauce I ever had that's not at home. Very good shredded beef tacos.  It's NM style and that means you all get sopaipillas at the end of the meal?  What's not to like?  I would definitely come back

Si Señor, I eat there.
   Dinner for three on a busy Friday night and we were seated quickly and served promptly. I am not saying that they didn't have a line at 8 o'clock. They did. They quickly cleaned and prepped the tables and worked hard to keep the wait to a minimum. They were helped by several large groups that left about the time we arrived and the staff quickly separated the tables and sat people.
   We ordered a round of Coronas's and were presented with the standard basket of chips. This included four choices for dipping; a mild red salsa, bean dip, sour cream with chiles, and a hot green chile salsa. The amount of sauces could have been greater and we were never offered a refill on chips and salsa.
   Almost every item on the menu is served covered with a chile sauce, your choice of hot or mild. I had the two burrito dinner and the Blonde had the chimichanga. Both were seerved with beans and rice. Meals were brought out in a timely manner and well presented. Both dishes were tasty and had the flavor one would expect. 
   I am only giving 4 stars because they give you exactly what you expect from a full service Mexican restaurant, but they do it well.

Warm Fuzzies (the good stuff)
-Excellent staff, helpful, friendly, and well trained.
-Quickly sat on a Friday night.
-Clean, well kept, quiet enough to carry on conversations.

Cold baldies (the not so good stuff)
-Standard Mexican fare.
-Chili sauce on about everything.

Si Senor is pretty good. The best part of the meal is the chips and four different dips at the beginning and then the sopapillas at the end. The food is decent, I've had worse, but I've had better.

The service is always very friendly, it's usually pretty easy to get a table even on the weekends and it's inexpensive. Out of all the Mexican food joints I've tried in the area, this has been the best.

Wow, I wasn't sure what to think after reading the reviews for this place-it seems like you either love it or hate it.....and I think I am stuck in the middle. 

We went here for the other night and there was a wait on a Tuesday night which completely threw me off. Maybe some people on Yelp were wrong and the food is just that good that people will wait awhile? Well, possibly but turns out 2/3 of their dining room was being renovated so they were just seating people in the one that didn't need to have any work done on it. Usually this wouldn't bother me but I had a flight to catch so I wanted the process to be a little quicker. 

Once seated we were greeted and got our fresh chips with four different kinds of salsa and sauces. If you're a free chip hound like me, be prepared to pay for a second or third basket since they charge $2.95 after the first one. One was definitely enough to split between two people. Everything on their menu looked appetizing and I ended up going with the flautas since I didn't want to be that girl on the plane carrying on leftover Mexican food. They were fresh and brought out with a heaping service of refried beans, cheese and rice. I love their presentation of the food-it's laid out on a school lunch like tray and rolled out to you on a random little cart (kind of like a bussers.....hopefully they dont use this for both). There were a lot of bigger groups there, including a birthday party next to us in which one of the kids came up to our table, said "Muuuuuurdeeeer" then walked away. Can I get a wtf? 

By the time the sopapillas came out, I could only stomach a bite or two but it was delish!

Great New Mexican food with a choice of hot or mild green chile sauces all made with Hatch chilies. Lunch specials are a great deal at around $7.50. If you like New Mexican food this is the place, good family atmosphere

I dream of their green chili  and chile relleno (made from hatch valley chilis - you can really notice the difference)...  Their green salsa is excellent.  The other dishes are pretty standard but good.

The service is also good.  I love how each dish comes with complementary sopapillas - sooo good!

Food was good, but a little cold by the time we got it.  I had to try and find our waitress because 2 tables that were sat after us got their food before us.  While I understand they were busy, an apology from the waitress would have been nice.

Si Senor is a restaurant on Alma School and Ray Road featuring New Mexico Mexican Cuisine. When you first sit down, they give you a basket full of around 20 chips, a small bowl of red salsa, chunky green salsa,  refried beans and sour cream dip mixed with jalapenos and milk. It has great Mexican music playing in the background. It is a nice building with red tile floors and authentic wooden chairs with sunflowers painted on the back. My friend and I came for lunch. She's also a Yelp reviewer and I am a mostly a Google reviewer but I'm going to post to Yelp as well now. The lunch specials include one drink and 1 sopapilla for dessert and they're mostly price about $7.95. My friend ordered the chili relleno which comes with rice and beans and I ordered the cheese enchiladas and it was supposed to be a beef taco but I don't eat meat so they made it a bean taco which I wasn't that happy with because I would have rather had a tostada but they would not substitute on the lunch menu. We persistently asked our server to give us more red salsa, since it wasn't even two tablespoons per bowl. The server said that they don't like to give a lot of salsa because it goes to waste. We asked for more bowls and they were going to charge us but we said we weren't going to pay. I ordered a red enchilada but instead they brought me green, so I brought that to our server Valerie's attention and instead of giving me a new fresh red enchilada she just came with the red enchilada sauce told me to pour it over the green, which I wasn't too happy with. Our server was pretty much annoyed with us the entire meal. I don't know why. She was a lot more friendly with other customers at other tables. The food is passable, but it's not delicious. It's just your standard Tex Mex, but most Americans would love it if they never tasted authentic New Mexico food from Albuquerque or Santa Fe. Anytime I can eat chips and salsa though, I enjoy the meal. The portions are very generous and I was happy to know that they do not use lard in their beans. All in all, it was a decent experience even though we had to fight for more salsa every step of the way. The sopapillas were delicious and they give you the whole jar of honey to pour on that. We got the cinnamon ones. All in all you'll probably enjoying a nice lunch here with TVs around the walls beautiful pictures and a clean spotless restaurant.
So glad this is still here.  We used to come often but moved to SoCal.  On this trip we stopped back by and WOW as good as ever!  We spent 8 years in New Mexico and this is exact!  No imitation here!

My family has been eating here for as long as I can remember! They have the best New Mexican food in the valley so far. The service is always great too. The combo plates are always a win and they have some super great lunch specials so you don't overdue it =) This is also home to one of  my favorite margaritas!
The Service was good. They have some specials for happy hour. Overall though the quality of the food compared with price was lacking.  Nice, authentic feeling mom and pop place though.

Great Food.
We stopped in on a whim on a bust day.
Seated pretty quick. 
Service was quick. And they were busy.
Food was delicious.
Great chips and salsa with variety of salsas.

This is the most legit New Mexican food place I've found in the Valley. Los Dos Molinos is more popular, but Si Señor's dishes are more traditional New Mex style. Their chile is great. If it doesn't make your face sweat, your nose run, and your eyes water, it's not good chile. I never leave this place disappointed with the heat and flavor of the green and red chile they use. Service is always pretty bad and slow, but it's worth it.

So our whole family has mixed reviews about this place. My husband and I very much dislike the food as do my in-laws, but my parents both love it. I can't do spicy and this is New Mexico style Mexican food, which from what I understand is always spicy. When I ask for food that isn't spicy, I end up getting things that have zero flavor! My husband likes spicy but says that the food doesn't have much flavor other than the "spicy" sensation. So I feel a bit like Goldilocks: this food is too bland, this food is too spicy. But nothing is just right. However, the place always seems packed, so obviously there are a lot of people who disagree with me. My husband and I just can't understand it!

I have to post my experience here. I used to come here for business and take out once in a while. I called on 3/22 and ordered #5 with chicken and double rice, no beans. I opened the box and it was cheese (no chicken) and beans.. I called and let them know. I was told that they would charge my card back $16.25.. 

It is now 4/17 and I have not seen my money back. I have also called and left 8 messages for the manager who is apparently never there, nor does she call people back.. 

I am a member of the Chandler Chamber of Commerce and now everyone there knows my experience. I'm extremely disappointed that I was just lied to and blown off after all the $$ I have spend there in the last 4 years. The food has really gone downhill and my husband never wanted to go because he says its just microwaved food that's marked up 10x.. Maybe this place will go out of business before they fix what's wrong
the chile rellenos are awesome! -- order it "rainbow, and you'll get both red and green sauce!

This is by far my family's favorite restaurant.  The service is always excellent and the food is consistantly outstanding.  My husband and kids love the green sauce (I'm a red sauce girl), their tamales are delicious and enchiladas to die for.  Not the greasy food you get in some Mexican dives.  The refried beans are how I judge any other place I try and none ever stand up to theirs.  The white dip that comes with the chips is crave worthy.  Don't even get me started on the mouth-watering Sopapillas.  Yum!

FINALLY! New Mexican done right! If you've lived in New Mexico for any length of time, you know exactly what I'm talking about. Green chili is the name of the game and Si Senor does it RIGHT!

Their chili con carne is not to be missed. You really can't go wrong with any of their menu items. But I do recommend the con carne. I could literally live off the stuff!

Visiting Si Senor brings me back home to New Mexico if only for a short time. Absolutely love the place! But with that said, I do have one complaint and I warn all who are planning on visiting this place-

Once you sit down, order and eat your meal something bad will happen... Any other mexican restaurant that you visit in the future will seem less than adequate when compared to Si Senor. Si Senor has tainted my opinion of other establishments - FOREVER. NONE can compare to the fantastic entrees that are served at Si Senor!

You've been warned!!

Have enjoyed in the past my favorite dish at Seniors many times. The visit last week was on a different level.Ordered my favorite dish, paid for it then as I left the restaurant I decided to go back and use the restroom before moving onto my next stop. As I went to the restroom there where two servers cleaning up the plates from my meal. I saw them laughing and saying " yes the cook put stuff in his food" I don't want to imaging what was put in my food and have no idea why they would put a foreign "something " in it. I do know one thing this is my last visit to this establishment and If there going to keep going down this path then things will catch up to this restaurant. I hope this review will help move this along.

The first thing I have to mention about this place is the chips and dips they serve.  Wow!  I mean WOOOOWWW!!  They bring out hearty chips along with 4, count 'em 4, different dips: red salsa, green salsa, hot bean, and some sort of spicy sour cream dip.  When you go to another Mexican restaurant after eating at Si Senior's, you will be pretty disappointed that they only served you one or two choices of dip with your chips.  

I've been here more than a handful of 10 in a span of ten years.  Every single time, the food was excellent, the place is clean, the atmosphere is cool, and the service is good.

I usually order either the Chili Relleno Plate (green chiles) or the Green Chile Plate.  Both are well made with top notch ingredients.  They even get their chiles from Hatch Valley.  

To top it all off, after your main course, they serve you with a choice of regular or cinnamon sopapillas.  I usually have to give mine up, since my daughters just can't get enough of those.  

Their house-brewed flavored iced tea is very refreshing.  It's the perfect beverage to compliment the dishes they serve, other than margaritas.

As you have read from pretty much all of the reviews about Si Senior, you just can't miss trying the chips and dips.  All of those people just can't be wrong.

My favorite New Mexico food anywhere outside of Albuquerque!!  Nice atmosphere, good service, great food. I love the stuffed sopapilla and we all love the sopapilla for dessert. Don't forget the honey!  

Hint:  if you want a "normal" portion go for lunch.  Otherwise they are HUGE. Also, be careful with the salsas as they're all very hot!

I usually don't like New Mexican food...but this spot is the exception.

Double-down on the warm, green chile salsa.  Put it on everything...you won't be sorry.

Chips/salsa are quite a bit more addicting than most places.  I usually get one of the combo platters as it has a bit of everything and all of them are excellent.  Finish up with a sopapilla (sugar preferred) and you just slammed a perfect meal.

Best Mexican restaurant I have been to in this area! The food was amazing. The tortilla chips and dips were the best. I had the chicken fajitas and took quite a bit home with me. They even serve a complementary dessert.

The staff was friendly and helpful. Service was above and beyond!

This is a solid Mexican place for a sit down meal... if someone were asking me for a local place for Mexican food I would have no problem recommending this place... along with a few other places. 

The street style tacos were good, they serve a variety of salsas with their chips, and the value is decent. The thing is there are a number of places in the area that are as good for Mexican...

I love love this place! It's not too often you can find really spicy green chile here and it's delicious! The red chile is also fantastic, lately I've been getting the red chile burrito smothered with the hot green chili! Yum! Oh and I love the white salsa also. This place rocks!
so coming from Texas the bar for decent mexican food is pretty high but Si Señor was on point, service was good, food was very good and the sopapilla at the end was a nice surprise

Has become my go-to Mexican food joint. The chips with the green sauce and the jalapeño creme sauce. Then the halfy-halfy red/green chili chicken chiminy-Changa followed up promptly with a complimentary hot and fresh sopapilla cinnamon and sugar, or just straight up plain with honey. Damn. I'm going to go tomorrow.

I have been eating at Si Senor for about 10 years now.  I love the fact they use Hatch peppers.  Their sauces are also among the best, and they bring out 4 kinds of sauce (well, one is a hot bean dip) with chips when you sit down to eat.  I noticed they seem to have recently changed their chip recipe to make them more healthy - and I don't like their new chips nearly as much as the old, greasy, salty ones.  Also, their menu prices keep going up fairly often.  Best time to go is lunch and look for the tiny menu usually stuffed in with the tray that has honey, etc.  You can get a great lunch for about 7 dollars (10:30 to 2) and it includes tea or soft drink!  Ordering off the menu, with drink, will cost about double that.
I enjoy the lunch special.  I have tried both the Chimichanga and taco/enchilada plates...both are delicious.   SERVICE IS EXCELLENT.

My favorite place in Chandler for 15 years. #8 Red Chile plate is my favorite. I wish the beans were more chunky though. Free chips and salsa. Free sopapillas. The staff is excellent. The restaurant is always clean. Authentic New Mexican not cheap TexMex.

I have eaten here on three different occasions.  The first two times I would have rated them with 3 stars.  This last time I am being generous with 2 stars.

The food was mediocre but the drinks were good. Service was slow.

Our food came out and it was lukewarm. The rice had absolutely no flavor whatsoever. My husband had ordered a chimi and it was soggy. 

I really like the salsa selections with the chips.

Si Señor is an awesome & very reasonably priced spot for lunch. For $7-$8 (not including tax/tip), you get an entree with rice & beans, a drink (soda, iced tea), and a sopapilla for dessert. But to be entirely honest, I would pay that for just the chips & dips that come out first! OK, I am a bit obsessed with chips & salsa/guac/etc. in general, but Si Senor has FOUR different dips, all delicious -- a red salsa, a hot green chile dip, bean dip, and a crema/sour cream dip. 

I went here a few weeks ago with a work group, and I basically took almost all of my "actual" lunch home since I went to town on the chips & dips.

Lunch specials!  The problem is the service is SLOOOWWWW!  They use that ridiculous cart system and the waitress makes a pass at all of her tables before getting back to the kitchen.  It is very challenging to eat and get back to work in an hour unless you're on your game and order quick, etc.  Regardless, the food is very good, the hot green salsa is HOT and the chip basket with its four dips is yummy too.  Sometimes they try to charge for the chips or auto-grat you, so watch out.  I still give it a 4 because the lunch specials are so cheap $6.95 or so and include a drink and a sopapilla and rice and beans.

As always, the food and server was great.  Hostess was too busy carrying on a personal conversation to greet people as they walked in.  Asked me 3 times how many in the party after I kept saying 2. Was very distracted. Finally had to tell her she kept asking the same thing.

Worst service ever!!!! We been here before. Great then. But tonight, not so great. We seen our beer on the red cart and soda we knew it was ours, but she stop to take orders in between while our beer mug got warm. It looked frosty at the time it was on the cart. We just one table over. Deliver already !! Everything was slow tonight. Looks like new people. Cleaning crew didn't even pick up the tables too. Not going back !!

Yuck.  I've been here so many times because my family loves it, but I cringe every time I have to attend a family event here.

Typical overly fried or sauced or cheesed gross generic Mexican food with no flavor or personality.

I've literally tried just about everything on the menu and have been completely underwhelmed.  Now when I have to go there, I just order a plain bean and cheese burrito because it's simple enough to not be flavorless and boring.

The chips and salsa are pretty cool, though I don't care for their red salsa.  The other ones, including the bean and ranch dip, are good though.

I used to love si senior but they have changed their green chili con carne from beef to pork. The overall quality seems pretty low as well. The flavor just isn't as good as it used to be. I would give a 5 star if they changed it back! Salsa is always good and I actually love the chicken stuffed sopapilla but the carne is what I crave! Please change it back!
This is excellent. Great chile you can taste the hatch valley. My wife is from New Mexico and wanted a taste of home for her birthday. She is all smiles now. Great food and severe. Highly recommend

I've been here several times and loved it every time. It is definitely my favorite Mexican restaurant in town and I especially enjoyed the enchiladas with green sauce, even though I usually do not like green sauce! The lunch prices are very good, so if it's your first time trying Sí Señor I recommend going during lunch hours. The lunch meals are essentially the same size as the dinner meals for a lower price. Both are worth it, though!

In Las Cruces, NM this place is a bit mediocre, due to some of the amazing competition there.  

When placed in Phoenix, it blows away much of the competition.  But I miss southern NM food, so I am biased.  

Get the rellenos - green chiles stuffed with cheese and then battered and deep fried.  

Love the salsas and free sopapillas.
Just left this place sfter getting no service... never be back.. what place has all the waitress on break at the same time... dumb

Being from NM and going to school where this restaurant started (las Cruces, NM) makes me a bit biased but this is a good overall NM place.

Hands down the best part is the salsas and chips they bring out before the meal. One red, one green chile enchilada sauce (warm), one sour cream chile/ jalapeno and one bean dip (warm).

Overall the other food is good with the typical NM fair, nothing outstanding but all good. I like the Gorditas plate.

Interior is Santa Fe style, kinda outdoor feel.

I had a #1 combination with Hatch green chili to go.  It was so much food that I am stuffed and there is still a full meal left.  Everything was delicious and the Hatch chilies give it the right amount of kick.  I can't wait to go back.

This restaurant was AWESOME.  Great atmosphere, service (thank you Alex), and the FOOD.  We came here because of the Yelp reviews, and we certainly were not disappointed.  We arrived on a busy Sunday night, the NFL playoffs (Chiefs vs. Steelers) were prominently displayed on two large screen TV's, and there were lots of large parties throughout the restaurant.  Our service never skipped a beat with all of the surrounding large parties...impressive.  We started our experience with two margaritas, and Alex smartly suggested choices from their happy hour menu.  $2.00 margaritas....well, yes please!  The menu here is expansive, and offered many choices of the classic Mexican fare.  We live in San Diego, and have lots of choices when it comes to choosing Mexican food, so when we find a restaurant like Si Senor, we are pleasantly surprised.  My wife had tamales, and I chose the chicken enchiladas with green sauce.  Also, the chips and salsa came with three other dipping choices...a bean dip, spicy red salsa, and super spicy green salsa.  The chips...wow...light, crunchy, just the right amount of sea salt.  Delicious!  With the first margaritas down, we decided to step up our game and selected the Patron Perfect margaritas from the drink menu.  On the rocks with salt of course...and again, we were very happy.  Fish bowl sized came to mind with these huge tankards of Patron tequila, fresh limes and a float of Gran Marnier!!  Time to fire up the Uber app, because these bad boys are bringing on the BUZZ.  Oh...the food.  Delivered quickly and on a really cool red little cart (careful, the plates are hot), our meals were set in front of us and we dug in.  The tortillas that hugged my shredded chicken were the highlight of the meal (well, until the dessert)...light, flavorful, homemade just like my old neighborhood.  You can tell that the food here is made with a true sense of pride.  My rice was steaming, just enough spice, and soft to the mouthful.  The refried beans had a nice layer of melted cheese on top, perfect for a bustling forkful of rice into and back into my pie hole.  The green sauce was packed with plenty of zip, but not enough to pull the fire alarm.  Just spicy enough to let me know it was there.  We finished our meals, and with plates cleared Alex brought out a cinnamon topped treat that looked like little pillows.  I can't remember what this delight was called (two margs down...), but I know several other Yelpers mentioned it.  Wow, what a treat!!  Light, fluffy, and warm to the tongue, this was a really cool end to our fantastic meal.  Four margaritas, two heaping entrees, chips/salsa, and the great dessert...$59.  Not bad for a really nice evening with my wife, great food, and fun atmosphere.  The Steelers stole the game, but Si Senor captured our culinary hearts.  Next time we are in town, we will for sure be back!  Thanks again for the excellent service Alex, we had a blast!!

Way back in high school Spanish class we learned to conjugate verbs.  So, here goes:   bland, blander, blandest;  boring, more boring, most boring.

The food had poor presentation & the service was mediocre.  My margarita was ordered with no salt and little ice.  It was served with salt and lots of ice.

The taco salad and chimichanga were tasteless. There are no black beans so you are stuck with refried beans. 

Here are some better places to go: Valle Luna-Chandler, Garcia's-Tempe, Macayo's-Tempe, Phx, Chandler.   For fast food, Somburro's is good.
The food was very good but VERY spicy. That is just a personal thing I guess (even though I like spicy food) but other than that it was delicious. The Sopapillas were AMAZING!

I've been eating at this restaurant for years and I've never had a problem with the food. I could eat those dips they serve with the chips all day long! The reason I'm only giving them a two star review is the fact that while I still eat here I've received consistent poor service from the waitstaff. They just aren't very friendly and our drinks stay empty for far too long even when the restaurant isn't busy. I usually just get take out nowadays if I decide to stop by. I've been on the look out for good Mexican food closer to home.

Work right by there and only ate there once before my family came to town and saw it rated well.  It doesn't look like much from the outside, but it is so good.  First went there for lunch trying to satisfy my sister's pregnant hunger for something melty and spicy.  Much to say it hit the spot so well we were back the next night for dinner.

Both times we needed to wait 15 or so minutes for a table and this is not a small place.  We found out later that it was well worth the wait. The first round of chips and salsa/dip (there are 4 of them!) is complimentary and the next round is $2.95.  The chips and dips were great.  Some spicier than others.  There is a red, a green, a bean (which is not think), and a sour cream.  

Both times, I ordered the combination plate #3 which has a crunchy taco, an enchilada, chile con carne, a tamale, and rice and beans.  There are 3 different chile sauces and I went for red chile both times.  It is the best chile sauce I have ever had.  The refried beans were a little cheesy, really warm, gooey and delicious.  The rice was fantastic and anything the chile sauce touched must have turned to gold.  

The complimentary sopillas were terrific and  hit the sweet spot to finish the dinner so well.  All in all, it is a must go for Mexican food lovers but be warned.  GO HUNGRY!
We finally visited Si Señor after being encouraged by family members. We were pleased overall by the service, and even more pleased by the food. We will return in the future!

Ok, first I will admit. I got tired of this place when I was in Las Cruces. The competition for good NEW Mexican food is fierce in Las Cruces, so this was never my first choice. Now that I don't have Mesilla restaurants close by, this is my favorite place. We have tried to find good New Mexican food in Phoenix and some come close, but still just not quite right. Si Senor comes in consistently good and at a fair price. My favorite is the white salsa. I remember visiting the Si Senor Express in Cruces when heading home and getting a quart of this salsa. The green mixed with beans is also very good. The red is sad for me. To wimpy. I like the lunch specials. Just the right portions to make me feel full and NOT over stuff my face! The sopas are also done exceptionally well. I usually get the plain one, but the sugar and cinnamon is a special treat as well.

I enjoy this place Everytime we go but it always starts out terrible, gets okay, then back to terrible. The wait is long during prime time, when not prime it's okay but not sure how the seating chart works. We get the crappy table Everytime. Food and order is good and dessert always good but when the bill comes we seem to have to wait a long time to cash out.  Better luck next time for us, we hope. Lol.

This restaraunt is convienently located right next door to Planned Parenthood. Not that it means anything, but it's a really good place to stuff your fat face with chile rellanos and margaritas when your tests didn't come back the way you wanted. 

Other than that it's pretty delicious.

Since this place is close to home and I love Mexican food, I've tried very hard to like Si Senor's over the years.  Still "not feeling it.". The service is always good, ditto for the chips and salsa but the entrees fall short on taste. I know New Mexican style food and this isnt it.

Went here for lunch.  The lunch menu is the traditional items you'd expect at a Mexican food restaurant.  I've also been here for dinner and the food is better for dinner, IMO.  I do like the way the food is New Mexican style here.  Great Red Sauce!

Anyway back to the lunch review..  I love the variety of sauces they bring out with the chips.  There's a simple lunch menu where you can build your own combos or order the traditional "bundled" items.  The food was good tasting and good quality, but nothing spectacular.  Again, I think if you ordered the full combo dishes for dinner you get more of what they are famous for. (New Mexico style, great chili rellenos, etc..  

A great treat at the end is the complementary sopapillas!  Very good.

So, why 3 stars and not 4?  The service was friendly but slow and not super attentive.  When i used the restroom there were two large soap dispensers and they were both empty!  This means no soap for customers or employees!  Yuck.  This freaks me out when I find out stuff like this in restaurants and to be out of soap in both containers means no one is paying attention for quite a while.  Opening the door from the inside was a chore too because they were set up with air dry only machines, no paper towels to grab the handle that all those other people who couldn't wash their hands grabbed.  For me this means grabbing some TP and two fingering the door open.  Ok, I'm a little strange, but still..

This place has great potential to be 4-5 stars for me; they just need to give a little more care for the basics.

I'm from Carrizozo, NM and grew up son of a restaurant owner with some serious Mexican food game! I am an enchilada fanatic. Si señor totally gets it! From the acidic red sauce to the Hatch green chile down to the fried egg on top. Can't beat this place. It's my way of visiting my NM "home" without leaving Chandler.
