The complimentary chips come with 4 dips, a bean, sour cream, salsa, and green chili. Nice touch versus the usual chips and salsa. 
I ordered the chicken fajitas. The rice was a little soggy, but everything else was good.

My husband loves New Mexican food and this place was amazing.  A friend of ours recommended it as she is a New Mexican Native.  We live in AJ but will travel to go here.  Love that they give you sopapillas.   As a previous reviewer mentioned that it is hard to screw up sopapillas.  This is true, but I am a sopapillas connoisseur and  have gone to places where they do screw it up.  I love this place and am so thankful to have a true NM restaurant here in the valley.

The food is a bit too spicy for me.  If you like spice and can stand the heat, you'll want to try this restaurant (salsa, sauces,  green hatch chile, etc.).  Their white salsa tastes like a mix of spicy salsa a day thinned out white quest dip.  After two chips with this salsa, my mouth was on fire.

 I love the chicken quesadillla!  I always request fajita veggies to be added.  Delicious and fresh!   

This visit (1/13) I had the cheese enchiladas plate and it was great!  Although, the "mild" green sauce was not exaclty mild.  The cheese crisp was smaller than that of other Mexican restaurants and was not crispy (compared to restaurants like Rositas in Mesa or Nandos in Chandler). The guacamole wasn't my favorite.  Sopapillas with cinamon, sugar and honey are yum-my!  Service was attentive and friendly.

I don't typically like Mexican food, but this place was great. The food was good and they offered 4 different salsas with their complementary chips (beware the salsa is hot). The lunch wait was a little long, but all in all good job.

My brother loves this place. 
Apparently on account of the lunch specials. 

The Service was okay. Our poor waitress was about 10 months pregnant, and I hated asking her for anything. They bring your food out on carts which is different, but made me feel better for our waitress. (did I mention she was practically crowning!) 

The chips were stale, when we asked for a fresher batch she said "they're all from yesterday so they are the same" - Kudos for your honestly, I suppose. 

The food was... bland, and boring. Even with the 7 dollar price tag, including drink and desert, it was not worth it. 

It's now an ongoing joke any time we go out to eat with my brother, "Anything but Si Senors"
La comida es excelente,  las quesadillas de pollo son excelentes,  y las sopapillas dan el toque final.

Love this Mexican food for a dinner out on the weekends,
My husband LOVES hot and they have hot and I like it mild and they have that as well the green chilis are so good I cant even explain to you how good they are.

Real authentic food and not a bad price for good food.
We have five kids under eight and they all love it here lots of food for a small price. The girls favorite is they order a large home made pizza size tortilla with a ton of cheese on it it comes on a metal pizza pan thats how large it is

I think the only issue I do have is they charge for a second basket of chips for $2.95 but were not talking just plain chips and salsa they bring out a basket of chips with 
2 salsas, a bean dip, and a jalapeno ranch dip which is HOT but so good you cant stop eating it..so have plenty of water on the table before you start LOL
Love the chips and salsa. Never disappointed here even when it's a special day/holiday.
My wife and I stopped in today for a very late lunch.  Awesome red Chile pork and the wife loved her burrito.  Special patron margaritas were great.  We will be going back
We love this place! Always consistent and always good. The salsa is amazing and hot! One of our favorite places to eat. And the servers know the food (recipes) very well.

Service was great, but food needed some work. I had the green enchiladas, the sauce was on point. The tortillas seemed little dry/ over cooked. My wife had the gorditas which also were just okay. Rice n beans were very tasty. I would return, to this location only if in area. Nice fix for former New Mexican.
We were hungry for Mexican food and found this place on Yelp.  It quite possibly was the best Mexican place we have been to in AZ

Si Senor is a family favorite. I always judge a Mexican restaurant by there beans. If you can't get beans right you've already messed up.  The beans are homemade and fresh.  They have a lunch special for 6.99 you get your entree and a drink and a sopapiya. And your meal includes chips and 4 different kinds of dipping sauce. Si Senor is know for the New Mexico chili and they have mild and hot green chili.  If your u sure try it. Its inexpensive and see for yourself. Its a New Mexico cuisine kinda food.

This review is based on several bad experiences with this restaurant. We live in Chandler and started going to this restaurant when they first opened. At first we were impressed with the chips and dips - 3 dip choices was great! But....then things changed.... We went there for dinner and one of the chairs was broken and when my mom moved it out from the table to sit down it pinched her finger to the point that she had to have her finger pryed out from the two pieces of wood and it had crushed her finger so bad that she was crying. You would think that a resturant would be mortified enough to at least comp her meal or appologize! They were not. The second bad experience was the food poisoning that we got from the tamales. Horrible!!! Several months later we tried again and this time we were charged for additional chips and salsa and my daughter asked for a side of salsa that came in a 1/8 cup container and we were charged $1.25 for it!! We mentioned it when we went to pay and they said that they now charge for any extra salsa or chips - period.
You would think that a Mexican restaurant with all the competition they have especially in Chandler would try a little harder for loyal customers. We have moved on and found Mucho Taco - much better food and service!!
Good food, reasonably priced, humongous portions & they give you warm cinnamon sugar/plain Sopapillas for dessert which is included in the meal. Service is always hit or miss that why I gave 4's
Good Mexican food.  Better than anything else around but menu doesn't offer much of a variety

Amazingly delicious Mexican food. So señor has it all great food and great service and a nice atmosphere. This is the best Mexican food in all of Arizona. If you haven't had this place you are missing out.
A thousand times yes.  Been here a million times and always good. Real live New Mexican style food.  Yum !

Based on the yelp reviews, my wife and I visited this restaurant for lunch during a recent trip to the Chandler area. We were seated immediately and drink orders were taken quickly. Like others have noted, the tortilla chips come with 4 dipping options: A warm bean dip, a green chili salsa, a crème dip and a pico. The green salsa was spot on. The classic margarita was decent with definite taste of tequila.

My wife ordered the lunch burrito with chicken with green chili and I ordered the lunch stuffed sopapilla with shredded beef and red chili. The shredded beef in my sopapilla had good texture and decent flavor and the red chili sauce over the sopapilla was outstanding. My wife's burrito was very large and the green chili sauce was excellent. With that said, both platters came accompanied by flavorless yellow rice and canned refried beans. Pretty standard southwestern accompaniments. The mains were definitely 4 star but I wish the restaurant would offer other options then rice and beans.

I'd go back if I visit Chandler again, but I'd go back fro dinner.

I've been eating here for years. This is some of the best Mexican food in Chandler. They also have a location in New Mexico where they get some of their famous Hatch chiles (a high-grade, sun-dried chile from Hatch Valley) that they use for some of their dishes. They make their own tamales and tortillas in house. Martin and Irene Castillo established the first Si Señor Restaurant in New Mexico in 1984. This location in Chandler opened in 2001 and is a huge local favorite. They always have some great happy hour specials, four dipping sauces to choose from for your chips and a live mariachi band on occasions. The hospitality is always great here and the food is pretty amazing. And of course you can't leave without having some delicious Sopapillas for dessert.

Awesome Mexican!  I absolutely love the casual atmosphere and I always order the cheese enchiladas (they actually use real cheese).  They serve Hatch brand products which is top notch.  You know it's good when you see more Mexican Americans than Caucasian Americans!  Not ritzy, but that's what gives it its charm.  Check it out!

My first visit to this restaurant was for lunch. I'm not a big fan of New Mexican food because of the need to really spice up their food but Si Señor impressed me with their fare. I had the lunch combo of a hard shell taco and cheese enchilada. I requested the green sauce served along with the beens and rice. The rice was cooked to perfection- light and fluffy with just the perfect amount of seasoning. The beens tasted fresh and the taco and enchilada were exceptional. Overall a great value served with excellent customer service and the ambiance to match. Overall a wonderful dining experience. Well done and, Si Señor!

As always I'm not disappointed at all. Went here for lunch and had their lunch special for $7 which included the drink. I had the chili replenish which was actually two large ones along with beans and rice. Mom had the enchilada and taco. Both of us had the hot green chili sauce. Yummy. Of course we filled up on the chips and four types of sauces/dips first. Of course we saved room for the sopapillas. Melt in your mouth goodness topped with plenty of honey. We have enough to for two more meals. Not bad for less than $20.
Yummy New Mexican Food!  Love it! One of our favorite places to eat!  Great Service!!
Good bean dip, OK chips. OK green chile, although they need a medium green option.  I don't understand why when going from CO closer to Mexico I can't find anywhere with mole sauce?
Great food and service.   The shredded beef burrito has always been a favorite.   Four different dips for the home made chips are very good.  Lunch specials are priced incredibly cheap.
Have eaten here many times, it is New Mexican food.  The chips and salsas are really great.  4 different salsas to dip in.  They make a meal in themselves.  Good food at a good price.

I feel like I've been searching all over the valley for NM style food! We made the 40 mile drive over here to meet with some friends because we heard that this was the place to go for NM food. We were seated right away & started with some cocktails which were great. Our server brought out a platter of chips with 4 different dips/salsas, score! I ordered the shredded beef burrito enchilada style which was SOO good. The meat was so flavorful & it was actual green chile! I felt like I was back home in NM :) My husband ordered ground beef gorditas which he loved. Our friend ordered chicken gorditas but they brought out beef & it took a very very long time for him to receive the correct order. We were all finished with our food by the time his arrived.  Our server never apologized for the error, just kinda took the plate & left which is what took my review from a 5 star to a 4. When we were leaving around 12:30pm people were lined up all outside, this place gets pretty busy! Can't wait to come back here for another burrito!
Great family place! Love the green Chile pork Christmas style (1/2 red & 1/2 green). Nice margarita menu and the sopapillas for dessert hit the spot.
Great Mexican Family Restaurant!!! Our Waitress Valerie Was Awesome and food was hot and delicioso!!!

OMG, the chips and salsa starter is enough to keep me coming back everytime I visit my sister in AZ!!! 

Cant decided red or green chili?!?! Ask for christmas, THEY GIVE YOU BOTH!!!

Being in the mood for some Mexican food and wanting to try something local and close to where I lived, figured we give this place a try. Service was good place was clean and friendly but food could have been better. I had ordered the Sopapillia plate with ground beef. The Spanish style rice seemed to be more like minute rice with the Spanish seasoning and my Sopapillia fell apart with the ground beef inside reminding me of the ground beef served at Taco Bell or some fast food chain. The ice tea was not good either tasted as if was made from tap water. I managed to make it through the meal while being constantly annoyed at the plates that my meal was served on as it is a hot plate siting inside another holding plate, but as I would eat it would shift out of the holding plate. The plates and the whole experience brought back memories of when I was younger high school/college student and I though Pancho's was great Mexican food. For the price I paid I have had better. You do however get chips and Sopapillia with every meal which were good.
Really good if you aren't watching your weight.  I like the sour cream dip with chips.  Sopapillas are really yummy as well.
The salsa is yummy - I had the green chile cheese enchiladas - so delightful!

These guys are one of the very few places that offer hot green chili, and they don't use jalapeños to make it hot like lots of places do. If you're a chili head then you'll love the food here. The other nice thing is the sopapilla after the meal. Who doesn't like sopapillas? The best part was lunch for 2 was only $15.

This place is solidly just-okay. Not terrible, will get you full, but certainly not good. Mainly, it's not fresh. Also, it's extremely gringo- like they got all their ingredients from Costco. I think the people who give this place rave reviews have never been to Mexico or had decent Mexican food before. So if you don't really know what you're missing, go here. You won't be disappointed. If you've ever been to Tucson or anywhere south of it, go ahead and skip.

This was a solid outing.  The service was quick and friendly.  The food was really good although the menu was missing some of my favorites.  The one standout was the Green Salsa that came with the chips.  AMAZING!  Great heat and flavor, what a combination.  Trying to go the low carb route so just ditched the chips and ate with a spoon after drizzling across the Fajita plate.  That salsa alone is worth the return trip.
Food was way overpriced for the taste. Beans overcooked. Tortillas seemed stale. Server was horrible. Avoid this place. Dont waste ur $. Sorry bout iiiiit.

A Mexican restaurant lives and dies by it's chips and salsa.  If that is a decree you follow,  then Si Senors is alive and well in the East Valley.   Served with four dipping varietals including a refried bean dip, red salsa, green chili & spicy sour cream and hot, fresh tortilla chips, the beginning of this meal hits the spot every time!  One of my favorites is the chicken fajita platter ... the meat is moist, marinated and grilled to perfection. I just wish the margaritas were better ... I've learned to stick with beer, too bad.  Other than that, the food is always muy bien.  Salud!

Duped, duped, duped! This place had some good aspects, almost enough to overlook the entire rest of the experience, almost. In fact, leaving the restaurant I actually remember feeling pretty good about the meal, but we were duped...

The chip and salsa at the beginning of the meal, and the included dessert at the end, seemed to give us slight amnesia as to the reality of the whole thing.

As we sat in the seat of our car reflecting on the meal we had just consumed, our eyes were opened to the reality that nothing about the meal was even slightly good other than the chips and salsa that had deceived us in the first place.

The actual entrees appeared to be rolled out on a dirty dish cart. Really? You couldn't carry out our food? You couldn't put it on a larger tray? Or maybe even used a different cart, that didn't double as a dirty dish cart that looked like it had been in a school cafeteria? And to top it off our entrees came off the bottom rack... hello, that's usually where half eaten soup bowls and pizza crust go!

Most of the food was soggy, and not all together memorable...not to mention this is less than authentic Mexican food. There were also several small hairs in the food...eyelashes, I think? 

But the worst part of the entire meal was their epic deception and blasphemous betrayal of the sangria. We order a carafe of "real" sangria that was rather small for $18, which would have fine except that it reminded us a boxed wine, but we couldn't quite place it...it was not until we got in the car that we realized we'd been duped. The "real" sangria, is actually a brand of store bought sangria you can get 1.5 liters of for $10. No wonder it tasted like boxed wine! Are you kitten me! I've never felt so duped and will not make that mistake again.

If you'd like to have a similar experience to this on the cheap, head on over to your local Safeway, pick up a bottle of "Real Sangria," and a couple of deli chimichangas. To make it an authentic "SÌ Señor" experience, be sure to ask the deli worker to roll them out on cart for you.

Was the food good her??? SI SENOR!!! Lol! The food here is luh - jit! They start you off with chips 2 salsas, a jalapeño sour cream dip and bean dip. The portions are big and well priced. They end your meal with warm sopapillas. Every table has a bottle of honey to go with the sopapillas. But seriously the food is so f*cking good! The second I walked in, my nose told me the food was gonna be great. The green chile is PHENOMENAL! But you get a choice if red and green, I did half and half. Red chile is bomb too but I'm a green chile kind of person. Anyway, try this place. Once you're done with your meal you'll be so satisfied you'll feel like you shoulda worn a condom. I can't wait to go back here!

We loved this place! I can see why they have so many good reviews. I got the ground beef tacos. They were on corn tortillas and were the deep fried kind that are so good. Not like a Taco Bell taco. The cheese enchiladas were nicely sized and served with either green or red sauce. The chips come out with 4 different sauces/salsas. All very spicy. 
We will definately come back!

My family eats here every Saturday. The past three times, have been disappointing at best. The manager is unprofessional, and doesn't know what she is doing. The food tastes like plastic, and the food is swimming in frying oil, because the oil was never up to temperature. I recommend, going else where. Prices going up, with portions going down.
If you can't handle spicy food, don't even try this place!  The food is spicy but good....and don't forget the sopapillas!

This was a very good Mexican Restaurant. They had a very good variety of salsa's when they brought out the chips. I was seated right when I walked through the door. The service was really great and friendly. 

I had the ground beef taco's and they tasted amazing. The food arrived within five minutes of me ordering. I felt like i was down in Mexico. This place feels and looks like an authentic Mexican restaurant. The rice and beans were cooked perfection and i could taste the seasoning in the rice. Also, I got red chili and smeared it all over my taco's. It wasn't to hot or to spicy, it was just right. 

If I could go again I would. For that one night I actually thought I was down in Mexico getting some taco's. I would recommend this place to anyone. The culture and the food makes this one of the best Mexican food Restaurant I've ever been too.

I pity the poor folks who don't comprehend New Mexican cuisine. I was turned on to this place by a friend of mine who grew up in Gallup. I asked where the best New Mexican food in Phoenix was and this was one of 3 places he loves. He lives in North Scottsdale, so it's easily an hour round trip with no traffic (since when is there no traffic in Metro Phoenix!) so he readily admitted that that journey doesn't happen very often. He, like me, stops there on the way back from Tucson (easy stop from the freeway) or if he is playing golf in the Chandler, Mesa, Gilbert area.
 
Here you go:
 
The BEST free salsa & chip plate I have ever had. #1 all time. This is worth the stop!
 
Hatch chile rellenos. They don't get any better. I often get 4 or 6 to go after we've eaten.
 
Maragaritas....... as good as they get. If you are driving .... no more than two.
 
Tamales...... none better. Fabulous burritos.
 
Stay away from the Americanized dishes and enjoy the best of Nuevo Mexico.
 
Get the #1 plate & pray you have room for the sopapilla(s). They'll bring you another if you are nice!
 

Just like Tia Stella used to make! Vaya con dios....... you'll be back and back and back.
Tried Si Senor last night for dinner and definitely enjoyed the food! Love how spicy everything is. The chip platter is excellent and we loved the sopapillas after dinner.  Yum!!

HOT!!! There's little mercy for the tame of tongue here...but that's not necessarily a bad thing. The food is flavorful too. Just use caution when ordering. I've been here a few times, and the service has always been nice and attentive. The dining room is clean and pleasant. And the food is very good...it's just hot too.

The chips they give you when you sit down are served with 4 dipping sauces--all hot. Even the Bean Dip is hot (whaaa?). And the Sour Cream Dip? Hot too. Maybe this is strategic planning to get you to order drinks quick fast in a hurry? I dunno; but the sauces are also good too, so you can't stop dipping. Diabolical!

On the table today: Chicken Enchiladas, Juevos Rancheros, and Ground Beef Tacos. My tacos dish was the only one that wasn't hot. But I love their tacos. They remind me of my granny's tacos (I think I even taste some love cooked into them too). All of our plates were served with beans and rice, which are also not hot. So I had the tamest plate. But the red sauces on the Enchiladas and the Juevos Rancheros = hot. Nevertheless, we were all happy and left full. A good thing.

Overall, I recommend Si Senor. It's not "typical" Mexican food (it's supposed to be "New Mexican" food I think); but it's good food that will make you happy. Especially if you like it hot...but also if you don't.

Good, authentic New Mexican food.  (Don't confuse this with Mexican... they are NOT the same.)  Very reasonable prices.  Atmosphere a bit on the weak side (primary reason for not getting 5 stars).

Have been to this restaurant at least a dozen times.  Service is usually quite quick. and the servers are always quite nice and polite.   Plenty of variety on the menu.  Drinks are reasonable and good.  Sopapillias for desert every time.  :-)  When they bring the chips and varieties of salsa, be sure to try the bean dip... it is fantastic, as is the green chile salsa.

Solid place, a good stand-by resturant for when you are drawing a blank on where to go.
The burrito platter has a ton of food on it and tastes great. Awesome Hatch Valley Chile too!

Love coming here to get my New Mexican green chili fix! They have the best green chili! I always get the combo plate at lunch, such a great deal! I love the dips that come at the beginning as well. The sopapillas come at the end complimentary which is always amazing. Yum!

My co workers and I are obsessed with this place...amazingly quick service, delicious chips and dips--you get 4 different kinds!!  Lunch special is such a bargain...meal with rice, beans, drink and a sopapilla!  Let me have it all the time!
Had the Chile Rellenos and was really good, Good Food and a nice atmosphere.
Best Mexican food in the east valley!  Prices are decent.  Service was awesome.

Very good food. I love the atmosphere, the chips and dips they immediately bring to your table. They refill sodas constantly. I try and get there before 2pm and get their lunch deal, which they even honor on weekends. Hmmmm, I'm craving them as I'm writing this. Prices are fair. Great customer service. Terrific family restaurant. I reserve 5 stars for fancier restaurants,  but this comes close.

I'd rather starve. Service is subpar, the front desk staff just glare at you when you walk in. Have the ask to be seated. Then you'll wait another 10 minutes for a server to ask for drinks. 10 minutes later she'll appear with drinks and take your order. 

Food is bland and no flavor. The food here isn't authentic nor is it good. Save yourself the trouble and pass this joint v

This restaurant has been here for YEARS and now I know why. The staff is very attentive, which was very refreshing with having a younger waitress she was so prompt and continually checking on us. Wish there was a medium salsa and not the sour cream (I think) dipping sauce with the chips and salsa and thinner chips. My carne tacos were pretty good. Big test was for my other half, he's extremely picky with his wave huevos rancheros and he was very excited while eating his. Was a refreshing New Mexico style he's been searching for since he moved here, and he's Italian so that says a lot!

If you haven't tried New Mexico Mexican Food -you need to check it out ASAP! The food here is amazing, the staff is extremely friendly. We went over the weekend and service was a bit slow - but the House was packed so it's understandable. Chips and salsa are excellent, and the hot sopapillas that come out for dessert are to die for! All around delicious!!

Consistently good food.  I love the tostado platter.  Sopapillas at end of meal are awesome.  Only thing I would change about this place is the salsa ... They bring a wonderful variety out with chips but they are all very spicy, and the one mild option you can ask for isn't very good.

Started with a complimentary selection of salsas and chips. We came primarily to try the green chile stew, it was very tasty & spicy. Desert was one of their sopapillas and I filled it with lots of honey...yum!
To wash it down, the sangria was great.
We'll be back!
Always a must when I'm in Phoenix area. The green chili is the best in town. Try the pork, you will not regret It! The complimentary sopapilla is the perfect ending to the meal.

Awesome lunch specials! The lunch specials are massive portions that include both a drink and dessert - sopapillas. The food is so flavorful. You can tell it's quality ingredients. With lunch you lunch you also get chips with 4 different salsas! Really quite a deal. The customer service is always great here.

Delicious, spicy dishes with good flavors.  
Might be too rich but ok once in a while :P
Delicious! Awesome pork green chili, burritos and enchiladas! Can't beat a warm sopapilla with honey at the end of your meal. YUM!

The customer service was amazing the food was so good. I had the fajita salad Yum Yum and my husband had the beef  chimichanga super delicious. Our server was absolutely amazing younger female super nice and super super nice.

My parents have gone to the original Si Señor for many years. In 2014 we stopped at the one in Chandler.

It was DELICIOUS! This year we're planning our trip to Reno making sure we go through Chandler just to eat here. I love chili rellenos and they make the best. 

We also got take out chili rellenos from the Si Señor in Los Cruces. Best ever hotel meal in our decades of travel. 

We love Si Señor!

You know when the rating is still high after so many reviews that the place is doing it right.

Found this place when our new pastor and her husband invited us out for lunch after church one Sunday.  So glad they did.

We loved it from the moment we sat down.  Greeted by several members of the staff.  Felt welcome from the get-go.

After placing our drink orders we had time to peruse the menu while munching on delicious chips and four choices for dipping - love how it is presented.

The first time around, I ordered and enjoyed their chimichanga.  Huge portions and wonderful flavors.

Most recently, when we went back, I had their two burrito plate (one beef and one chicken).  This might be my most favorite plate and my go-to on return visits.  It was so good.

We treated a friend of ours to dinner and he loved his choice which included hatch chili's.  He said he'd definitely return.

Great atmosphere inside.  Plenty of space to sit and relax with family and friends.  I highly recommend Sí Señor's if you are looking for a great spot with great food.

Have been coming here for over 10 years and this Was my favorite restaurant.  
But on our last visit we noticed they are giving smaller portions of chips and salsas.  Also the food tasted  different (could be because they have 3 new cooks and new manager). The tamale was very  masudo (doughy).  Tacos did not have good taste either. Very disappointed!
Get the hash brown breakfast burrito, best thing ever, even better when you're hung over.

Many people don't understand the regional differences in Mexican Food, as with all types of food. New Mexican food is, in my opinion, at a different caliber than Mexican food that is offered in states like Texas, California, and Arizona. Trust me I've lived in each! This is primarily due to Hatch Chile that is grown in Hatch Valley which infuses more flavor than any chile the rest of the southwest is accustomed to. Everyone must experience New Mexican at least once in their life to understand what I mean. If you can't make it over to Albuquerque or Santa Fe then Si Señor is your absolute best bet! 

We come here extremely regularly. Anytime there is a birthday, this is the place (and we have a large Mexican Family so tons of birthdays!) The food is delicious from the flavorful Chile Rellenos to the sweet Sopapillas. Is the restaurant itself memorable? No, we aren't talking about a fancy place, but between the great food and friendly service you will not leave disappointed!
Love this place one of the few Mexican restaurants to offer vegetarians a choice on the menu.  Food is fabulous staff are great busy place!

First of all, I LOVE the chips and dip set up. That green chile salsa is amazing, but packs quite a bit of heat so beware! Seeing as AZ water is disgusting I usually order an iced tea. They serve a really tasty raspberry very lightly sweetened. I absolutely hate overly sweet tea, but their's was perfecto!
The cheese enchiladas are average, cheese, tortilla, sauce. Tacos are pretty good too, but I come hear for the tamales, red chile con carne, and sopaipillas! They're the first Mexican restaurant I've eaten at that doesn't have dry tamales. They are so good! Chile con carne is delicious and tender, falls apart in your mouth. I've only had the red because the green packs a little too much heat for me. The end of meal sopaipillas with cinnamon and sugar are so yummy!

Very good chips and salsa delivered to start the meal.  2 salsas, a bean dip, and a jalapeno ranch dip  -  and the chips are above decent.  The second batch of chips and salsa will cost you $2.95, however.

But the menu prices are a little high.  Spent $26 on 1 Appetizer, 1 Entree', and two drinks.  Nothing we had was outstanding, compared to other local places.

I'd go back just to make a meal from 2 batches of the chips and salsa, drink water, and get out of there for under $5.

I was craving for that similar Mexican cuisine I had back at Sadies  in Albuquerque.   Had to wait 20 minutes for a table for 5, which was not too bad.  Since my kids only eat sopapilla, I asked if I can order them as appetizers and the waiter said don't worry about it.  So I ordered the:

 #14 Chimichanga  Plate w/ shredded beef, beans & rice (3 stars - beef was too dry, dish looked sad) & a stuff beef sopapillas for my oldest to try.  Since they usually serve the sopapillas at the end of the meal they forgot to bring it out for my kids (not a big deal). The sopapillas were alright (3 stars).

The good: 
- service
- chips & spicy dipping sauce (yummy!)

The bad:
- no fruit in my "real sangria"
- my Chimichanga Plate was dry & didn't look that appetizing

Food was ok. If you are a fan of spice with no flavor. I went here with my family after reading the positive reviews. The best thing that I had was the Margarita, wife and kids enjoyed the chips and dips. The Decor of the place is very nice and the server was very attentive. Just wasn't my "cup of tea" when it comes to flavor of the food. I'm an AZ native so maybe it just a NM thing, but I didn't care for the same heat on every item I tried.

Would I return? Probably for just drinks and appetizers.

This place was packed, had to only wait 20 mins for a table. The chips and dips we beyond spicy hot. Service was quick and attentive. 10 bucks for 2 chili relanos, expensive. Beers were cold. If you like it super spicy, this is your place! Also the refried beans we beyond delish!
Starters are chips and 4 dips. The sour cream dip was really good. Food was okay, not too great. It's good if you're in rush and this was the closest place.

After eating at Si Senor on Alama School road in Chandler i was impressed with the quality of food and the flavor. Best Mexican food  in the east valley with a New Mexico touch to the spices . I ordered the Chicken enchiladas which came with rice and beans . I tried the red and green salsa on the enchiladas to compare and the green was new mexico style
yum yum    expect a short wait on weekends as their is always a lineup but worth the wait

Pros: Awesome chile/salsas, probably the BEST green chile I've had in AZ. Red chile was great as well and so were the dips (with chips). Chile relleno (they use hatch) was awesome and my wife loved the chile con carne (green). Kid had a chicken plate and liked it and she is very picky so food was very good. 4 stars on the food.
Cons: Very slow service even to sit down. We asked for refills and chips a few times before they finally brought them and we are pretty patient. The place is HOT and it seems even worse when eating that spicy hatch chile. All the tables around us were using menus as fans. My michelada came with a nice fly floating right on top when I got it so they gave me a new one. No discount, no next one on the house but it happens. 2 stars on service.

One of our favorites!!!! The 4 dips with your chips and the included dessert really make this place a great value. We grab 2 pacifico's which go best with spicy food. You can tell everything is homemade and fresh. So tasty!!!!
Nice food and good service.  The foods are better than the food in LA.  Well be back more until we leave AZ.

Was in Chandler for a medical appointment and decided to check out Is Senor. Glad we did. First the server saw us right away, the Margaritas was great, then they bring us chips four three sauces and beans EXCELLENT. So we ordered number #6 Chili Rellenos (two large ones) and the number #3 taco, tamales, red chili, and enchilada. Excellent food!! So hard to find a GREAT Mexican restaurant around Queen Creek. this place is worth the drive. Great services and Great food!!

what can I say besides this is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix.  Authentic New Mexican food. I get the#1 combo and I try to not eat it all so I have room for the sopapia.  Only complaint is they serve pepsi.

I drove through rush-hour traffic to get here.  It better be good, I'm thinking.  My dad was visiting, and by "visiting," I mean he came to trade a vehicle and visit a friend of his in Chandler.  Somehow I fell into the mix because of a pull-out sofa I guess.  Being a fan of Sonoran Mexican food, rather than New Mexican, I was skeptical.  Admittedly I have limited experience with New Mexican food, but usually I find the meat to be over-seasoned and the chili to be too hot for my taste.  However, these good people in Chandler are from the same small town along the border I am,  so I trusted their taste was similar to mine, and I was not disappointed.

Five stars from the top by serving four different dips with the hot, crisp tortilla chips (green, red, bean, and sour-cream based).  All were spicy, but addictive.  Only the first basket is free, but better than nuthin'  (I'm talking to you Mr. Carlsbad Tavern).  I had the flauta dinner after confirming they are made with corn, not flour tortillas.  Both the beef and the chicken were flavorful, but not overly seasoned.  I really liked the beans as well.  My husband had the chicken gorditas.  The chicken was, unfortunately, really dry.  

It was a Friday night, and in spite of being extremely busy, we had excellent service as well.  Not even knocking off for the dry chicken.  Especially since I wasn't the one eating it.  Would I drive back to Chandler just to eat here?  Probably.  Just not during rush hour.  And why do they call it "rush-hour."  No one was rushing anywhere on the 101.  I am so glad I work from home.

Not the same as I remember since I moved. It not worth the money . I just wanted to know if it is the same as I remember. There no heart or passion in the food. For new Mexico food,  visit the state of New Mexico for the food.

This is one of our go to places.. my mother in law always wants to go when she's in town. But today my husband and I went and it's mother's day. We both ordered ice teas we drank both our glasses and when the waitress finally came to give us more, she told us that they changed the free refills to only 2 and then you had to pay an additional .99 to have more. My husband and I both looked at each other and she left. I totally understand that on soda sometimes, but seriously on ice tea!! Come on people I think that's crazy. On top of that most of your cup is ice.. So how much tea are you really getting.. when she came to refill our glasses they were half full still and mostly ice. I think this is ridiculous.

Great first visit for lunch. Chicken tacos and an enchilada off the lunch menu. We loved everything. The chips and salsas were our appetizer and sopapillas were for dessert. Our server was on it too. We'll be back, for sure. Thank you for the wonderful lunch meal.

I've been going here since the week it opened. The food is better than average, somewhere halfway between authentic Mexican and Americanized.

I love the salsa selections and the chips are good. The food is nothing spectacular but I will go here on occasion just to get decent Mexican food.

Try it, you might like it... many people do.

I'm so torn on this review. Having grown up in New Mexico, I am a huge fan of New Mexican food and research suggests that chile may be addictive so I'm generally grateful to find a place to get my fix in the Valley. 

I had the huevos rancheros, which is two eggs any style over corn tortillas and smothered in red and/or green chile (in New Mexico, we do both and call it "Christmas." i.e. Question: "Red or Green?" Answer: "Christmas"). It was served with a side of refried beans and rice. (I liked the rice.) 

Si Senor uses the New Mexican red and green chiles but it didn't really scratch the itch, if you know what I mean. (The bean dip was spicier than the "hot" green chile. The bean dip was really good, by the way!) 

I just really don't have anything compelling to say about this place. Bottom line, after a 20 mile drive to check them out, I just don't think their chile delivered. 

The chips and salsa plate they start you with was nice. It included a fiery bean dip, green chile, salsa, and a sour cream. And, the fact that you get sopapillas at the end of your meal is a nice memory of my days in NM (but I don't remember ever having the option of a cinnamon and sugar one?!) although the texture of the sopapillas was off. 

I drove a long way to check out Si Senor and, truthfully, I would rather drive back to Albuquerque for some Carne Adovada (not even on Si Senor's menu) than back to Chandler; however, if I was IN Chandler already I would probably give them another visit - you know, research suggests chile is addictive...! I mean, I'm already wondering how I would have felt if I had gotten the stuffed sopapilla...

Wanted to love this place having just had a wonderful meal at Los Dos Molinos.  It was just ok.  Even the decor was uninteresting and had the feel that you would find in a rest home.  I was hoping for more of a homemade taste and unique environment but it ended up being pretty much like 90% of the Mexican food I find--it wasn't a cut above.  The chips and salsa were good and the enchiladas were perfectly fine but not special.  Same can be said for the rice and beans.  The frozen margarita was just plain bad--watery and without flavor.  The sopapillas were excellent.  There are too many better options so I don't think I would be back.

This place has it all....great service, great food and great atmosphere! Very fresh ingredients, authentic and tasty red and green chile to satisfy anyone's craving for New Mexican food. I promise you will not leave there hungry! Highly recommended!

Excellent. Loved the chips served with 4 dips; seasoned sour cream, homemade red salsa, warm hot green chile and beans. Had chicken enchiladas, 1/2 red & 1/2 green sauced , large portions-took one home.

Over priced and under staffed.  The food was mediocre at best and I've eaten A Lot of Mexican food.  

They charge for a side of sour cream, more chips and splitting a plate.  Service was absolutely terrible.  Took forever to get our server to show up to take our drink or, then our food order and to get us our bill and then bring back our card and receipt to sign.  

I will never eat here again and definitely NEVER recommend this place.

I have used "Si Señor" numerous times for catering, and they take pride in what they do. I love their salsas, specially the white one, is spicy but delicious!! Excellent atmosphere, the owner Irene, is very humble and wonderful. Yolanda is awesome, she always very friendly and smile.. all the server we have wonderful time. 
I will ALWAYS recommend "Si Señor" is very authentic, and the best part is the sopaipillas, my kids love them with honey.
Well done, and next time you read a bad review... it makes me sad, how people is not appreciated of hard working people that serve them, and still they want things for free!!! I hope you go and enjoy the food, and be a repetitive customers like we are!! 
Thank you "Si Señor" for always give us excellent service and awesome food!!!
Arlette Lenzi,

I lived in New Mexico for a few years, so I was happy to hear about this place. I love Hatch green chilli and that is the type of chillis they use. They serve an awesome chip/salsa platter for free!!!! The bean dip rocks. The wait staff was very nice and on top of things.  Don't forget to order a rita.

The food is so authentic and tasty. The salsas are pretty hot but the red is the mildest.  The mild green in the enchiladas is awesome.  They are always busy but services is fast and friendly.  Prices are reasonable and the have some great lunch specials.

Being from New Mexico, the food is one thing I really miss!  Si Señor is good, but nothing compares to the real deal.  I love that they have sopapillas!  I just wish they brought out a whole basket with the meal  instead of just one for dessert! I recently made some posole and ordered a dozen to go along with my dinner.  Delicious

My mom and I went to Si Senor tonight on a whim.  We coudn't find the place we were looking for and she wanted Mexican.  Someone had mentioned this place a while back.  Well I'm gonna have to tell this person off!  JK... I can't hold her accountable, she just has horrible taste in Mexican food.

We both ordered  the #1, tamale, relleno, enchilada, taco.  Its all served on one big plate, covered in either red or green sauce.  Oh and a pile of "chile con carne".  

If you need to cover the entire plate with tons of sauce something is probably wrong.  You get a large pool of beans covered in... you guessed it - CHEESE! and some mediocre rice.  I wouldn't have minded all this cheese or sauce if what was under it all tasted good.  The relleno was fried to death, greasy and flavorless.  The tamale was ok, but I only had 2 bites.  I think that may have been from your grocers freezer.  The "beef taco" was ground beef!  WTF?  Okay, we make these at home because we grew up on a budget and we had to do what we had to do.  But we never called them beef tacos.  WHY? Because beef tacos are SHREDDED BEEF that has been slow roasted or braised with chile and spices.  Ground beef tacos are "hamburger tacos".  Ejole!  BUT, again, I wouldn't have minded if it at least had some flavor!  You're killin me smalls!  The beans?  Just fucking sad... brown ooze topped with melted cheese. Clearly from a can. Didn't taste the enchilada cuz I couldn't stomach any more damn sauce and the chile con carne looked like, well...canned.

I do have a couple good things to say:  The chips and salsa were good. I enjoyed the red salsa and the sour cream dip.  Good thing I always get carried away with the chips and salsa or I would've gone home hungry.  The sopapilla at the end of the meal was good.  Fried dough covered in sugar and cinnamon - you can't go wrong.  I have to say, the waitress was really friendly and accommodating.  

My point here is, its okay if you're not the most authentic (and I know everyone's opinion might differ on the way any one dish "should" be prepared) as long as you're putting out fresh flavorful food, you're doing okay.  

I hate to write such a bad review, but I have to be honest.  I should have gone to the taco shop down the street on Ray and Warner (Taqueria Mi Casita).  They have real (Mexican) food and I would've saved about half the bill!

Best Mexican food in Arizona. I would know... I used to live in New Mexico.  I've lived here 15 years, and no one comes close to this specific New Mexican flavor. Treat yourself and come here as soon as possible.  You're welcome.
This place is the bomb!  Great salsa with four dips and free sopapillas.  Green chile is amazing!  Also, the happy hour is great and they have a kids menu.

We wound up at si senor after a couple places were closed that we were looking forward to. The yelp reviews were pretty good, so we stopped.  

The service was pretty good, but really slow. I don't know what they would do if they lost their rolling serving carts, seems like they all had one.  

The chips and dips came out after a short wait. They were pretty good.  The chips came with 4 dips: hatch green chile, bean dip, some kind of ranch sour cream, and the salsa.  The salsa wasn't all that great, but the other sauces made up for it. That green chile sauce was great...and hot.

We got 4 different items.  The tacos, I thought were great.  Basic tacos, hard to do badly...They were good.  My wife had a chimi, the meat was really dry but the flavor good.  A friend got a combo plate with a few different items, no complaints there.  Then there were the fajitas...no sizzling plate, not even hot. They came out warm, and the friend eating them said pretty tastless.  

After the meal they brought out sopapillas...these little pillows of fried goodness made the wait worth it.  They were pretty tasty, but the sizes varied a lot and a buddy got the small one, it made him sad.

Over all, it was pretty good, I'd say a solid 4 star.  Pretty basic Mexican food for Arizona.

Had a brunch here with the fam one early Sunday after mass, since they were one of the few places open at 10. The ambiance was okay, a bit homey. I like the cashier counter and the ceiling reminds me of the one in Vegas. Anyway, our server was nice and patient. We didn't know what to get since it was our first time, but her timing was always perfect, not bugging us and not ignoring as well. Their menu was huge, literally huge, but the choices were okay. My dad had the gorditas ( AMAZING), mom had the burritos (not a fan of burritos but this one me likey!!!) and I had the taquitos. We all shared everything, and I didn't like the taquitos that much compared to what my parents had, but nevertheless, it was still great. I had horchata of course. And again, it was so good and refreshing. The dishes were nicely done, very clean. After our meal they serve this hollow breads I forgot what they were called, you're gonna be given a choice between cinnamon and plain, ohhh i love the cinnamon. Over all, I'm inlove with this mex restaurant. HELLA LOT BETTER than Garcia's.

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in East Valley Phoenix area. They make the best chili rellenos and then they have white salsa dipping sauce for your chips that is to die for. I highly recommend SI senor. They give away with every dinner free sopapillas honey for dipping sauce or you can get them with cinnamon and sugar this place is wonderful, have fun.
I LOVE this place. The food is always good and I have never had a problem with the staff. Their chips and salsas are amazing. I visit here wth my family often and its alway been great.
Best New Mexican restaurant!!  Haven't had good Mexican food in a long time!!! We will be back!

Awesome dips. Comes with 4 dips and chips. So hard not to fill up before entree comes. The service is prompt and the entrees are really good. I go for the mild green chili sauce which is super flavorful. My daughter always gets red enchiladas. She and my other kids have always enjoyed the sopapillas that come with the meal. Worth a visit

Their restrooms need updated   I judge restaurants by their restrooms. It's an attention to detail thing.

Wasn't able to try the food, so 1 star is based on the staff. Was coming from a wake and our family called ahead for reservations. The restaurant said they could take us, and when we showed up, they turned us away. After arguing with the hostess, we decided we were just wasting our time. Lady was like Gandalf not letting us pass! We stepped outside of the restaurant. 5 minutes in front of the restaurant, we tried to come up with new plan. The hostess must've wanted her point to get across to us, and flipped the open/closed sign...30 minutes before closing time... If their front of the house is that bad, I can only imagine how the inside is. If you decide to go, give the hostess our best, and hope she's having a wonderful day! She ruined what was already a terrible day for us...

This is an amazing New Mexican food restaurant. Very good chips and salsa. Great for groups. Always had really good service here. Friendly management. 

The cheese enchiladas are amazing. The best I have had. If you love spice this place is for you. If they tell you something is hot.... It really is. Tacos are really good. The quesidillas with green Chilis are to do for. The hatch green Chilis here can not be beat. 

Great food for a great price.  You have to check this place out you will not be disappointed.

My son and daughter wanted Si Senor's for dinner. We got their about 8pm not many people in the place. Our server was nice and timely with the drink, that was the plus side to my night.  After reading in the menu that the 1st bowl of chips & salsa are on the house, additional bowls will be 3bucks, told the kids this is the only chips they are getting. My daughter ordered the cheese enchilada dinner and it came with 3 huge enchiladas, which she enjoyed, my son ordered the chili rellenos which were also huge in size.  I ordered the shredded beef tacos combo, when I picked my 1st taco up, the filling feel right through breaking my shell, the meat was soggy like it was soaking in water, the other taco feel completely apart as well. The rice was lacking in flavor and the beans tasted like rosarita made them, I wasn't that impressed with the place so No Senor No Mas....
Meh. We were disappointed. Very mediocre. But the restaurant is very clean and would probably be a great place for a party.

Went there last nigh,a tall Spanish waiter took our order.
I order tacos but wanted flour tortillas,he said no In a very rude manner.when i asked why he said are you going to place a order or not.we all looked at each other and said wow,my friend asked him to smile to break the ice.due to that experienced I would not be returning

So excited to find his place!  Our new favorite!!!!!  Being from New Mexico, I can honestly say I feel like I'm home!  The sopapillas are amazing, don't forget to save room!  Nachos are a must try!  And I love the green chile, try the hot!!!!!
This is one of our favorite Mexican restaurants. They have great food, great service, great prices and a great atmosphere.

The chips a 4 kinds of salsa/dips are out if this world! As for tacos, unfortunately, the bean taco was average and the chicken taco was tasteless and NOTHING like the tacos at Si Señor in NM. But I will give them another try so I will go again to try the chiles as my fiance' enjoyed his and they seem to get good reviews.

I really enjoyed all the dipping options for the chip basket. All 4 were so tasty. My green chili pork plate was delicious. Service was great, food came out fast. The only negative I would say is the no substitutions rule. My mom wanted flour tortillas for her tacos instead of the corn and she was told no. I could understand if they only had 1 kind of tortilla but they have both. Kind of a bummer but I'll still be back.

AMAZING food!  I'm a huge fan of New Mexican style food having lived in southern New Mexico for 10 years.  Si Señor has captured the flavors (and heat) I love so much.  The prices are very reasonable and the entree sizes are generous.  My favorite is the red or green chile Enchilada Plate (with an over-easy fried egg on top)!  The Hatch green chile is very hot but has so much flavor it's definitely worth a little pain.  The margaritas are very good and the servers are nice and attentive.  They even finish off every entree with a fresh hot fluffy sopaipilla!  I'm definitely hooked (or maybe addicted?)!

Was my first time going to this restaurant, I was pleasantly surprised. The chips had 4 different kind of dips, this white one was super good but a tiny but spicy. The lunch special was really good, it was cheap for the amount of food you got! The lunch special included a drink and a dessert which was really good with the coffee we had gotten. Overall good experience and I would definitely go back

Great flavor to everything, all tastes fresh and delicious with a nice fiery kick to it all. Price was comparable with other places I've been. Solid service if not a tad quite. But not rude, more just busy. Will come here again as the Arizona Sonoran style is a tad too blah for my liking

Tried this place because it's one of the few places in Chandler I've never been to.

Great free sopapillas but those are hard to mess up...The free dips that come with the thick chips are spicy salsa, a jalapeno cream sauce, green sauce, and a bean dip that had a weird flavor I couldn't put my finger on.  Regardless of charging 3 dollars for an extra basket, we didn't finish the first basket because we didn't like it. My bill came to 37 dollars for 2 adult entrees and a kids entree. Loved my chicken enchiladas, but my fiance hated his combo meal of hatch chili and cheese enchiladas (they were out of tamales so he had to double enchiladas) and my 4-year-old ordered cheese crisp. Service was OK, a little slow and she pushed a bus tub cart around the whole time to carry things which was a little weird. 

Wouldn't come back with my family, Valle Luna and Abuelos has much better mexican food, less heartburn and service for the price so we'll continue to go there! If I knew it was more expensive and "New Mexican" I probably wouldn't have came here, I'm an Arizonan that prefers regular Mexican food.

Awesome service, cool atmosphere and mehhhhokay food. Came here for Sunday brunch and did not have a wait. However, after about 30 minutes into our meal, church let out and a real wait began. Get here early for lunch on Sunday!

The service was solid. Our waitress was quick to refill our drinks and made sure we were good. The decor was appropriate for the theme and ambiance of the restaurant. 

The food was pretty hit or miss. They started off the meal with delicious tortilla chips (not the thin as paper type) and some savory salsa. Definitely better than most restaurants' chips and salsa! Our table ordered a lunch chimichanga, chicken and green chili quesadilla, and a green chili sauce tamale. All mehhhh, but the tamale was not bad. The sopaipillas though... ON FLEEK! Be sure to have a cinnamon-sugar sopa to polish off your meal.

Give it a try; you might like it. It simply was just not my cup of raspberry iced tea.

Great food. My kid remarked on how fast we were seated and how quick the service was. The waitress spared him a nasty burn when he reached for the plate after being told it was hot. She has mom reflexes! Thank you Corina!
My favorite restaurant in Chandler hands down! I'm from New Mexico and the hatch green chili salsa is freakin delicious!

On my second and last trip I had the worst experience ever in any restaurant that I had ever been at. I did NOT feel welcomed and ladies were not very happy to work or serve me and they had the guts to put hair in my food. Maybe it was a gender problem I guess the don't like men

Very good! I had the enchilada plate and it was tasty! The amount of salsa they bring you at the beginning is fantastic - i particularly liked the sourcream & onion dip they provided - wow that was a pleasant surprise!

I love this restaurant! From the staff to the setting to the food... friendly, clean, delicious.

I've been here more than a few times. I've brought my son (the only one in my house who handles food spicier than ketchup), my granddaughter (in an attempt to build up her spicy tolerance), and I come by myself... because I love spicy!

The tamales and burritos are probably what I eat most often, and I typically do them Christmas style because I have yet to make a decision between red sauce or green so I just do both. 

They bring me chips and four kinds of salsa before my meal, all of which are fairly spicy. What's funny is because they have unique salsas in the white,  bean, and the hatch chile salsa... I tend to skip the red just because it's more typical. So far, I've only worked my granddaughter up to the bean one... baby steps people! 

Then, after I've stuffed my face, they force me to eat a cinnamon & sugar sopaipilla. Sometimes ya just gotta do what ya gotta do.

| Out-of-Towner Review |
I visit family in Chandler each year for Christmas, but this was our first trip here. The food is excellent. The number 3 combo plate (chili con carne, tamale, taco, enchilada, rice, beans) solved my pregnant wife's crunchy|spicy|melty craving problem she's been having for a few weeks.

The red sauce here is to die for. (This is a New Mexico style place, so you get Hatch Valley chiles as your main pepper ingredient across the board.) It is very, very good and makes the combo plate one of the best things on the menu. You know it's good when the taco is the ranked last on the plate. (And the taco was very good.)

Lunch/dinner combos are served with chips to start (which come with four dips) and sopapillas for desert. Get the cinnamon and sugar ones - they're great.

This place does get busy, so you will wait during peak times.
Horrible place to get tacos ... found a bone in my taco the placed smelled :( ...  my girlfriend didn't even finish her tacos smh .. well this was a disappointment .

Whoa. We have been coming here for over 10 years. I mean... whoa.

But this restaurant is actually one of the reasons we moved to Arizona. Her sister took us here the very first time we flew out to visit. We were so blown away by this strange place with bright murals on the ceiling and huge wooden chairs - and that was before the chips and 4 salsas came out. And the chile rellenos.

There is nothing outstanding about this restaurant. Except for the fact that for the last ten years, they have been consistently excellent 100% of the time. Who does that? Nobody. This is the only *company*, let alone the only restaurant, that has never let me down, and I go weekly. Is that important to you? If not, keep driving. Maybe there's a Taco Bell in your future.

What else can I say? You won't like every dish, nor should you. But you will crave the ones you do like, and there are many. And during the darkest times of your life, you'll go have an 1800 Margarita (or three) with good company. And you will order extra chips. Lots and lots of extra chips.

My wife and I were seated promptly by a disinterested hostess, but then ignored for 15 minutes. No menus. No waters. No sign of our waiter. Table had no silverware, and was dirty. Also happened to be right next to noisy kitchen doors, so servers were busy coming and going. Place was half empty, however, as it was after the dinner rush. Staff clearly knew we were there and choose to ignore us. Place seemed understaffed. We finally got up and walked out and the hostess said 'Thanks' and to 'Come again,' forgetting she had just seated us. Awful service. Unfortunate, because we've had enjoyable take-out from this place in the past. Food is decent Mexican. Just terrible service.

Si Senor is based out of Las Cruces, NM and serves Authentic New Mexican food. I have lived in New Mexico over half of my life. The Mexican food in New Mexico is simply the greatest. And Las Cruces has the best in NM. Unfortunately I have family in Arizona and the Mexican food that I have had there at several different restaurants has always been absolutely awful. The first sign that a meal is going to the dogs is when we ask if they have "green chile" and they look at me confused and say "What?". "Uhm... nevermind you obviously don't". Try asking any restaurant in the PHX area for red or green chile and they will stare at you with their mouth open... ."excuse me...". Our waitress at one of the most popular local PHX restaurants when asked responded, after the "excuse me... huh..." part with "Do you mean chili beans, or do you mean salsa?... Is that what you mean.... salsa?" 

So, knowing that a Las Cruces restaurant, Si Senor, had opened a restaurant in Chandler, certainly we HAD to try it while we were there. And they did not disappoint. We usually order the #1 combo (Beef tamale, cheese enchilada, chile relleno, taco, chile con carne (red or green - your choice), beans, rice, four different salsas with chips, and sopapillas (NOT "sopas" which is "soups", a "sopapilla" is a puffed fry bread) for less than $13 or so. And I always get it "green". Their green chile sauce just tastes so good smothering everything on the plate. Thank you Si Senor soooo much for opening this restaurant ... anyone who is from NM MUST go there when in town for the ONLY edible (New) Mexican food in town!! This was our first visit to this location and it will not be the last. BTW, when we were there the place was packed!! (Probably full of New Mexicans missing some of that awesome food from home!!). My ONLY complaint was that the sopapillas were covered with cinnamon and sugar. Although tasty, I like to use my sopapillas as a "plate cleaner"... dipping it in the sauce on the plate (or salsa), and piling on rice and beans and other scraps for a tasty stuffed sopapilla treat. But, at least there were sopapillas which only a rare few in the PHX area have.

FYI: Another reviewer on here states that this is no "Los Cuates". Obviously he is from the Northern part of the state where the "traditional" NM food is not as good as in the Southern part. "Los Cuates" is a terrible restaurant in Albuquerque that does not even come close to Southern NM cuisine. "Los Cuates" is, actually at the top of my personal list of the Worst restaurants in the state. I have lived in NM for over 30 years, and Si Senor is easily one of the top 10 "casual" (not gourmet) restaurants in NM. And is not a "poor attempt at New Mexican food", but is authentic "New Mexican" food. I do, however, recommend the green chile over the red chile. Most restaurants tend to specialize in one or the other. With Si Senor, their green is better than their red.
One, reviewer mentions red "enchilada" sauce. It is NOT "enchilada sauce... it is "chile" sauce. That is the difference between "New Mexican" food and Arizona food. We smother our food with chile sauce... not enchilada sauce. The sauce is made from chile and is used to flavor other foods, not JUST enchiladas. When you order a bowl of "chile" you get a soupy chile sauce with chunks of meat and potatoes. This is different from Texas "chili" which is a thickened tomato sauce with cumin and other spices, meat and beans. sopa = soup, sopaipilla = fried puff pastry, chile = the fruit of a chile plant or the powder or the sauce made from the fruit, chili =  a thick stew made with tomato sauce - cumin, and or meat and beans - and red chile powder, enchilada sauce = sauce made with chile - and several spices and usually tomato sauce - used in enchiladas.
Si Senor's has four salsas. Red, Green, a Green sour cream, and Chorizo and Bean. The Red is probably the hottest. It is served cold and has red chile, tomatoes, cilantro, onion, garlic, etc. The Green is not quite as hot as the red but can be quite hot. It is served warm and has green chile, and other ingredients (NOT pork!), the Green sour cream is served cold and is a refresher to cool your mouth off after having the hotter salsas! It has a bit of green chile and a few spices in it. The Chorizo (Spicy Mexican pork sausage) and bean dip, has red chile in the Chorizo, garlic and beans, etc. It is served warm and isn't really very hot tasting. My favorite is the Green salsa, then the "white" Green (sour cream salsa), the red, then the Chorizo. 

Down here in the Southern Part of New Mexico, we grow our Chile (chile capital of the World, thankyou), hot and we grow it well. Our food revolves around our chile. If you don't like chile, you won't like our food, period. Chile doesn't have to be hot. But usually, the hotter it is, the more flavor it has.

Outside: big white building in a strip mall. Inside: clean, sunflower/mexican/sedona motif.... but still feels like your inside a big white building in a strip mall. 

Pros: 
-Great chips & sauces. (white baja, green chile, salsa, bean dip came comp w/ first basket o' chips).
-Service... friendly... attentive
-Red chile sauce w/ beef
-Complimentary sopapilla at the end of meal
-Onions & veg were actually caramelized in beef fajitas (ohh sweet)

Cons: 
-Soggy taco shells 
-Ho-hum rice...and tamale.  
 
Good... but not great. If you're in the area and you're in the mood for traditional mexican/new mexican, it'll be worth your while and your $.
Food was okay, my rice was good but my flautas were super greasy and not very flavorful... The best thing about the experience was probably the bean dip and chips. But I've still had better

I like this place alot, and have been numerous times!

I go to lunch here quite often. The food is always consistently good. They do have amazing lunch specials though. I believe lucnh is from 11am-2pm here and they have about 10 options that are under about $7-$10 and are filling.

Service is great as well. This place has alot of seating, however it does get busy around 12 and for good reason. Go around 1:30pm to get your food faster :)

Service 5/5
Restaurant cleanliness 5/5
Food Taste 3.5/5
Value 4/5

I LOVE this place. I have been coming here for years and they never disappoint. The free chip assortment with your meal is always a hit. The service is always quick. The food is always done right and you can feed two people really well for less than $30. This is a win.  I can't get enough of the red sauce ontop of my burrito, so I usually get extra. Super smooth, smokey, and a nice slow heat. This place does New Mexican cuisine very well and is worth your time.
The last few months I've been living in Utah and seriously missing good Mexican food. Tonight I got my fix the food was great and the service was as good as the food.

I changed my previous review from two stars to four stars and am adding this update to say that I do not think Kevin works there any longer. We have been back a couple times since the last review and the food and the service was great once again.

Me and my wife are from Cali, but she is originally from New Mexico. I've been several times therefore we're both good on what Authentic New Mexican food should taste like. My friend lives in Phoenix so we were there last weekend to visit. He had never been to Si Señor, but heard several good things. So we went and weren't disappointed. We waited a bit, but soooo worth it. To start of with the chips and dips...yes dips! 4 different dips with a big basket of chips. Bombdiggity. Their hatch chili was on point. Both green and red. I got a chile relleno plate and my wife and friend both got a combination plate. There was more than enough food for leftovers. With the Phoenix area having so many local amazing restaurants this easily makes the top 3. Oh man I almost forgot the sopaipillas.... yoooo don't you dare pass up on those. If you haven't had New Mexican food... take a chance... trust me! 5 stars all day. Can't wait to go back.

This place is the best Mexican food I've had in many years. Their red  and green chile is amazing. Tamales and chile rellenos  are so tasty. Scottsdale has nothing that comes close to this place. It's worth the drive.

This was our 1st time here but definitely not our last. I have to say I love their chips. The bean dip and salsa were ok ,the green chili dip was fantastic! The kids meals were a great deal since they include a drink . 1 kiddo had the chicken strips and fries , The other had a hamburger and fries . The hamburger was huge , and very tasty ( I had to sneak a bite). The Husband and I both ordered A green chili burrito off the lunch menu $8.49 comes with beans and rice . Again, beans and rice were ok, the green chili was the star of the show for real!  The burritos were full of meat! Portions were generous and service was good. My favorite part was the sopapilla ! I had no idea they give you a free order of hot, fresh fried heaven which is also known by the name of sopapilla. Fantastic. Next time we will try something different and see if we can find a new favorite

Tried Si Senor for the first time last night. Our experience was just okay. We were seated right away but it took at least ten minutes before our waitress came to our table. Once she had served our drinks service did improve a little bit but it was only so so. The chips are served with four different dipping sauces. One is a hot red salsa, one is a sour cream type of sauce, one is a bean dip and one is like a verde pork sauce that is served hot. I enjoyed the hot red salsa and the sour cream sauce but I didn't care for the verde pork sauce.

I ordered a combination plate which included a cheese enchilada, a crunchy taco, a flauta and chili con carne all smothered in red enchilada sauce. The enchilada sauce was delicious. Spicy and tasted home made. I did enjoy the enchilada very much as well as the crunchy beef taco. My fiancé tried the two bean and cheese burritos smothered in the red enchilada sauce and these were very good as well. The beans here taste very fresh and creamy. The Mexican rice here is also very good. So overall the food was good and I would definitely come back for cheese enchiladas in red sauce. We were also served sopapillas at the end of the meal which were delicious and you can get them covered in cinnamon. Good value for the price.

The reason for three stars is partially because of the service and partially because of the ambiance. I do not mind an older restaurant that is showing some age as long as it is clean and taken care of. The table we were seated at had a big stain of red sauce directly in front of me on the table cloth. I also observed many dusty areas along the hallway leading to the kitchen which always makes me worry. Note to management, just take a little more time to clean at the end of the day it makes a big difference! Other than that pretty good experience. Food is good. Return factor 60%

This is one of my favorite Mexican food joints in town.  We've been going here for 4 to 5 years and each time have had a great meal.  The food is consistent and savory.  The atmosphere is somewhat basic but they have a great value for the food served.  

If you like a hotter than average salsa, the green Hatch chili salsa is awesome.  The sopapillas at the end of the meal are always a wonderful treat.

Yummy! This place is wonderful, beside great decorations and a beautiful mural of AZ when you walk in, the food is great. They give you chips and 4 kinds of dip to start. I ordered a traditional green cheese enchilada! It was huge and came with b&r. This place is a jem ! Reasonably priced abs very clean and friendly.5 starts.

Since I wrote my 2 stay review for Si Senior, I have been messaged by a few people with a blanket statement stating, "I am from New Mexico, so I know what good Mexican food taste like". I hate to be the beacon of reality but if it tastes like Si Senior, you do not know what good Mexican food tastes like, period. I have encountered this attitude from people from New Mexico before; like they are the authority on Mexican food. B.S!!! Being from New Mexico does not qualify you to discount my experience or be the authority on Mexican food. I have lived in two states that share far more border than New Mexico does (Texas and Arizona) and have encountered far superior authentic Mexican food in Tucson, border towns along the Rio Grande or El Paso; than in New Mexico. I am not sure why people from New Mexico think their opinion is far more valid?? I hold to my review and my palate. In the end, writing a review is your experience, not someone else's.

The warm tortilla chips with 4 different dipping sauces are the best part. One of them was sour cream based with jalapenos and some other spices. It was just delicious. The food was great and margaritas were really good. The only thing is they didnt have a bar area to sit at, so its a complete family restaurant but they do have happy hour. 
Prices are reasonable, waiters are friendly and every meal comes with a warm sopapilla which again was delicious. I was visiting AZ and a coworker recommended this place to me. I'm glad he did. Will definitely visit again when in Arizona.

this could be the best mexican in phoenix.  ironically its New Mexico style.  last time I went it was sat night and we got great service which amazed me because it was so busy.  I LOVE this place.  I always eat too much when I go so I try not to go too often.  The green chili is the best I have ever had.  They have weird hours. seem to close early and very limited hours on sunday twice I think I tried to go but they where close so just remember to check the hours before you head over.

This place was pretty clutch. My girl and I came here for some bomb Mexican food and we found just that! They start you off with a sexy little plate of chips, salsa, a white sour cream sauce (amazing), and some bean dip ( also amazing, especially when mixed with previously mentioned white sauce). We ordered the carne asada quesadillas, which were amazing, although a little on the overly cheesy side. If everything wasn't amazing enough, our entree came with free sopapillas! These come in either cinnamon sugar or plain. Always go cinny-sug. 

Will be back to try the rest of the menu!

Honestly, I'm a bit surprised by the number of good reviews.  My experience was far from positive.

Service was terrible.  As the four of us in our party observed, the waitress made a habit of bringing hot food out on a cart from the kitchen, and rather than immediately serve it to the table, she would stop by other tables on the way, takes orders, ask if they needed anything, etc.  This happened multiple times.  Seems to me that should be the other way around.

I ordered the chicken fajitas.  The rest of my party was served their food about 10 minutes before mine.  That is also unacceptable.  They felt bad about eating without me, and I didn't want their food to get cold.  The kitchen needs to learn how to time food so an entire table's order comes out at once.

We had to ask our waitress several times for napkins, silverware, and salsa.

After all of this, the food was sub-par.  My chicken lacked any resemblance of flavor.  The rice and re-fried beans were fine, except for the clearly over-cooked, dried out edges of beans around the plate.  The only person who mostly enjoyed their food had ordered a chicken quesadilla.  At least they can get cheese and tortillas to cook right.

They also charge $2.50 for a second helping of chips and salsa.  I've never been to a Mexican restaurant where they charge for more chips & salsa.

Overall, being my first Mexican restaurant experience in Arizona, I'm VERY disappointed(come on guys, I can throw a rock to the border.  I expected better!)  

I definitely won't be back.

My boss is from New Mexico and is super picky about green chile and has been raving about this place.  I finally went a bit ago and this is definitely one of my new favorite places!  I've been now a total of 3 times in the last month and I think it gets better each time I go.  

First off, the dips that come with the chips are so yummy!  The green chile stuff and the spicy white sauce are my fav.  I am really picky about chicken from restaurants since most chicken ends up being super slimy or fake tasting.  Their chicken is incredible, literally melts in your mouth.  

After your meal everyone gets a sopapilla (sp?) for dessert and those are the icing on the cake.  Just the perfect little treat after a great meal.

I'm so shocked by the bad reviews on here, either those people are crazy or there was something out of the ordinary happening that night.

Honestly this use to be me and my mom's favorite place to go to. We came here a couple days ago and got the chicken tacos. The chicken was SO BLAND and not seasoned at all. It was just boiled and shredded chicken. Very disappointing. I ate one and put the rest to go for my dogs to eat.

For quality and taste of food this place is a solid 5, unfortunately the service lack a bit at my most recent visit and it resulted in luke-warm food and a long dining time frame.  The menu has a good variety and what's included in the dinner is a good value (Beans, Rice, Sopaipillas, Chips and Salsa)

The four Salsa/Dips served with the chips are "hot".  I personally enjoyed them all, but  my family had differing opinions.  The sopaipillas were a little dry but drenched in honey they were still a nice treat.

The chicken chimichanga was large and delicious.  Of course the portion size was a little out of control so I was able to take some home for another meal.

The service was the major malfunction of our visit.  As it was Friday, it was busy.  We were seated in about 20 minutes.  We received chips and drinks fairly quickly, however once we ordered our food, it took at least 30 minutes to get it.  Several families who were seated after us received their food before us.  When we finally received our food it wasn't at an ideal temperature.  It was still warm enough to eat, but it did seem like it sat under a warmer for a while.  

Overall, I would recommend Si Senor as the Mexican food served is quite appetizing and well worth it.

Do not let the seemingly gringo name fool you. This place is LEGIT. Green Chile Sauce, Spicy and Smokey Red Sauce, Fluffy Sopapillas, and Homemade Chips and Dips to start it all off! A New Mexican myself born and raised until moving here in August, I NEEDED to find this place.
