Haven't tried everything on the menu, yet (and I am planning to do so) - but the Si Senior Combination plate smothered in red and green (Christmas Style) is delicious and plenty for a full belly and left overs. The Huevos Rancheros are also very good. The service was kind and very welcoming. The atmosphere is pretty basic (no frills here), but the food makes up for it.

We make the drive from Phoenix to Chandler for Si Senor- we love it for lunch! The price is right for lunch specials... for about $7 you get chips and salsa (two salsas, bean dip and sour cream dip) an entree, a beverage and top it all off with a delicious sopaipilla! Plates come out hot and delicious! It's not a fancy place but the service is great and the food has never let us down!

For lunch you can have a beer and an entree for under 10 bucks. oh and free desert...

Great food, good service. 

Great place.

Does get busy for lunch sometimes.

One of the best places to eat Mexican food in the area.  Really do enjoy this place, but beware ... it's hot ... well at least for this white boy.   My favorite are the combo plates.  Every time I go I try to get something different just to see, but one of my favorites is the stuffed Relleno .... but pretty much anything I have had here is amazing.  I also like how you get lots of different salsa's, bean dips etc with the chips.  These guys do it right!
The don't make their own guacamole. It's pre package wholly guacamole. What a disgrace!

I love this place! I drive all the way from Tucson just to be able to eat real New Mexican food since nearly all Mexican food restaurants in the Tucson and Phoenix area only serve Sonoran food. I highly recommend this place to anyone that loves red and green chile. You won't be disappointed!

This was my first time here and my server Jacob was amazing. I asked about the dishes and he walked me through them along with telling me about the different spice levels of their sauces. I would definitely recommend this as a place to go for great food, drinks and service!

First time ordering take out, did not get a notification as to when the food would be ready & they never answered the phone when I called about it, therefore the food was cold when we got it home. My tostadas were packed with the rice and beans so soggy. I'm done with Si Senor, very disappointed.

This place is ok if your in the mood for your food to drip grease. That literally was what my quesadilla does every time I go. Same with the tacos and burritos. Their chips and sopapias are really good though.

I ate there yesterday and picked my favorite chile relleno and was charged more than I usually pay. Was pretty sure it was a mistake but didn't notice until I got home and it wasn't a big deal. After coming back today for lunch (that's how much I love this place lol), I immediately noticed the updated lunch menu. Higher prices but now includes drinks. I wish I was given the new instead of outdated menu yesterday (or at least informed by the server) so I could have upgraded my and son's usual order of water for soda if I was paying for it. That said, I still love this place very much.

The food was wonderful, we ordered the homemade chips with guacamole and they were the best ever! The only problem we had was not with the food but with the noise, terribly loud. The wait staff uses carts and they are very noisy and since the floor is concrete and tile the noise just bounces off them. This is difficult for conversation, especially if anyone in your group has even a slight hearing problem.

Our family has been going here for a long time.  Love everything here and with s hot hats or Margarita it's even better.  One plus is the soppapillas they include for dessert.  Meal portions are also generous.

I got back in AZ a few days ago and was craving spicy, delicious, savory Mexican food. And since my parent live in Chandler, the place with the best Mexican food yelp rating was Si Senor. I know that Si Senor is actually New Mexican style food, but that was what I was in the mood for... some spicy green chille salsa!

Si Senor has not changed since I lived in AZ three years ago. It still resembles a cafeteria with tables coated in a plastic table cloths, cheap chairs, and tube style tvs hanging in the corners. 

Let me start off my saying the service was OUTSTANDING. Our server was very attentive and made sure that were never needing more drinks. The food also arrived quickly, and piping hot; but, the food was just not that great. My mom's chimichanga and my enchilda were piping hot but dry inside. We needed extra green chilli salsa to get through out entrees.

Oh well! I am glad to see this business is doing so well, and have such an awesome following. Maybe I will be back during my next visit to AZ.

I've lived in the area for over 4 years and only recently discovered this place (too many great Mexican restaurants to choose from!) I've been twice and have enjoyed the food both times. Only giving 4 stars, though, because it's a little pricey for what it is. The sopapillas at the end are a nice touch.

I do recommend this place. The food was really good and the staff was friendly. I would go again. I like the atmosphere and it was clean. I had the enchilada plate and a taco. We left full and satisfied.

If you're looking for a New Mexico experience, you're not going to find it at Si Señor. 

This place has been on my bookmarks for over a year now, ever since some Greyhead sent Andrew C. and I hate messages dropping the name of this place for our Carlsbad Tavern reviews. 

Will NEVER understand why people feel the need to do that  . . . 

We stopped in on a Friday night for dinner. 

Seated immediately, and our server was polite and attentive. 

No booze; just two iced teas. 

The chips and salsa came with four types of dips: Bean, Green, Red and some kind of Sour Cream and Green Chile combo (delicious).

Your first bowl of chips is complimentary; additional bowls are $3. 

We ordered: 

#2: Chile Relleno Plate with Both Red and Green Sauce
#14: Beef Chimichanga with Red Sauce 

The Rellenos were soggy, and very little spice.

The Beef Chimichanga was also soggy with unseasoned beef.


Monica O. said the beans tasted like Rosarita; I think Rosarita tastes better than the beans on these plates.

The best part of the meal were the Sopas, but those are pretty tough to mess up to begin with. 

What a bust, skip it. 

Nunca más, Si Señor!
Holy delicious sopapilla Batman!! The bean dip is fantastic, almost filled me to much for the good good at dinner. Prepare to have you food smothered in delicious sauce!

Very disappointing. The beans were good and rice was okay. I ordered a bean burrito enchilada-style. The tortilla tasted store-bought. The enchilada sauce was basically just tomato sauce. I couldn't even finish it.
There food is so good! I always leave satisfied , it always tastes fresh and the spice is perfect !

Just get the number 1!  Great meal, decent service and great sopapillas at the end.  We came here after picking out pictures in the same parking lot.  Very casual and the green chili was great, the number 1 has a cheese enchilada, chili relleno, tamale, beans, rice, & a taco.  Chips and salsa are also great!

One of the BEST places to eat! I moved here from Colorado 6 years ago and searched for awhile for a great Mexican food place to eat. I give this place 5 stars because it is that good and if your looking for a great place to eat this is it. We always get the #1 and 14. The salsas are the best. Our favorites are the green chili and the sour cream with chili. 
On The weekends you cannot get ahold of them by phone because they are busy. I just walk in and place my order. I have no issues doing that because I know the food is that good to do so.
I just this catered at work. Pretty good food! I'd have to go get their salsa!! Muxed white and red - just right!

The food was absolutely 5 stars, but the service was terrible! At 5:30pm on a Sunday evening, the place was busy, but half the seating was not in use.  Our waitress appeared experienced and competent- at least to her other tables. We waited, but no water, chips, or menus arrived. Finally, the waitress took our drink order and tossed the menus onto the table. My husband was the only one who did get water because he specifically asked for it. I would have ordered two sodas had realized my single diet soda was the only one I would get. Other tables were regularly served off a beverage cart supplied with soda, tea, and            water.                     

The chips, salsas, creama sauce, and bean dip arrived and were delicious but we were out of salsas by the time our  ($9+) assorted appetizer platter arrived. We asked twice for more salsas. By this time, the cheese on half the platter was cold and congealed. I asked for a refill on my soda, please, and the waitress affirmed that she heard me. Then our dinners arrived. My Chili Rellenos arrived without the usual side of tortillas, so I asked for some. Other tables had red containers of small tortillas on their tables. Like my soda refill,  the tortillas never showed up. I resorted to using pieces of the cold cheese crisp. The food itself was delicious--the rellenos were perfect- a combination of hot, gooey cheese, spicy Hatch pepper, and crunchy fried crust. My husbands #3 platter was equally delicious. I let the waitress know it was my husband's birthday, so she said "oh, congratulations" and then brought out the bill and the 3 sopapillas (hot, crunchy and delicious) that are part of the standard dinner. 

We sat and watched as our waitress was attentive and helpful to her other tables-- and there were at least 2 other waitresses and a helper in the dining area--so not as short staffed as I thought. The Check  totaled  about $60 for the three of us.  Having worked waiting tables for a living, I realize tips are an important part of a waitress' salary. We usually are very, very good tippers---at least 20%. Not so last night.

Ten Year Customers here in a great neighborhood restaurant. Si Senors goes up and down in quality as they hire and fire their cooks.  Sometimes in just ok and last night was simply amazing.  Their rates keep going upand prices and the little things they do to save money is annoying;  A.) They turn down the air. No A/C in bathrooms.  B.)  Hire waitresses that know how to wait tables C.)  No Paper towels in bathrooms?   Rates are same as Abuelo's and El Zocalo's. Their food is good but cheaping out on the little things make me wonder what things are skimping on that I can't see.

This place has decent food but I am surprised by the people who gave it 4 or 5 star rave reviews. It's not bad, but it's nothing special either. 

I went in on Sunday for a late lunch with 3 other people. We all liked our food but agreed that it was pretty much the same as any other Mexican restaurant. I was a little disappointed since the menu did not have a lot of choices and what was there was pretty basic. One of the people at the table ordered the combo plate they were told that they were out of tamales so she had to sub another taco. So, the four of us got chicken rolled taquitos, beef fajitas, carne con chile, and tacos. Wow, real exciting stuff. 

The pluses for this place are the variety of salsa that come with chips before the meal and the free sopapillas. Again, nothing really wowed my taste buds, but both were a nice touch. 

The waitress was very friendly but the service was spotty. She refilled our drinks before they were even empty but failed to notice that we did not have napkins or silverware until we pointed it out to her... after our meals had been brought out. 

Overall I didn't hate it; but I will not be back again since there are other Mexican joints closer to my house that have the same boring food so it really is not worth the drive for me.

I've been coming here for years and I absolutely love the bean dip. The food is pretty good and I usually have great service however my reason today for reviewing si señor 3 stars is due to the fact that multiple times when I have come in 30+ min before close they have told me they were closed. I was especially upset tonight as I drove 30 min to dine here and was told they were closing early. When I stated the hours of business the woman at the front desk advised me they were closing early so they could get their cleaning done. It's Saturday night and they closed at 8:30. Pretty upset.

The first thing that irked is the nickel and diming of the chips and salsa. Not cool. Ya I get it that everyone isn't a fatty like my girlfriend and I are when it comes to chips and salsa. That's fine. For the people who love chips and salsa like us though charging extra for more chips and salsa is BS. The main reason why it makes no sense is because they are the only restaurant doing that. The outside of the restaurant isn't very appealing but once you are in it isn't too bad. I was not a fan of the tables and how crammed they have you with everyone else in the restaurant. They have been around forever.  Invest in some booths. The food is what is giving this restaurant high reviews and I agree with that. The food was good. The different salsas and green chili were good. This restaurant has a lot of potential because of their food, but that's not enough to bring me back I'm afraid.

The food was average quality and the prices were  ver good. Starting with the chips and salsa. They were just ok, the chips definitely did not taste like they were made fresh. The 4 different salsas was a cool idea, but again, they were just ok. The shredded chicken and shredded beef burrito meal was a nice amount of food, but the meat seemed to be underseasoned.  The refried beans were average and the rice was below avaerage.The atmosphere was very generic. Very "strip plaza" Mexican restaurant like, no authenticity in the decor at all. The waitress did a great job, she was friendly and attentive. Not sure I would visit the restaurant again.

As several Yelpers have mentioned,  Si Senor is getting stingy with their chips and salsa,  which was a welcome and unique start to a meal there.  I eat lunch at Si Senor once a week on average,  and this apparent cost cutting measure has not gone unnoticed.  I seldom use more than a couple of the salsas anyway.  It would be nice if they could give you more of what you want and then you wouldn't be wasting what you don't want.  I understand the waste issue,  but don't sacrifice the best complimentary chips and salsas in the valley to fix the problem. The food is still good and the service is usually excellent. You can't beat their lunch specials!
Great place!! Spicy food - loved the soapillas!!! Highly recommend

This is one of favorite places for New Mexico style Mexican food. They have good size portions of authentic Mexican favorites at reasonable prices. I love their enchiladas and sopapillas. I also love the atmosphere. It's very relaxed and welcoming.

This used to be our Friday lunch hangout destination. 
I am not going to vouch for any of their entrees being exceptional or memorable. But saying their green nopal salsa is out of the world, would be an understatement. Creamy with a mild kick, just perfect. Most of our appetite would be satisfied eating chips and their green wonder sauce. Ordering Entrees was just namesake. If you like both red and green salsa, you can get their Christmas combination of sauces. Most of the entrees come with free sopapillas. Eat them with a drizzle of honey, and you are in heaven!

Also don't forget to carry $1 dollar bills (4 for $1)to get the Mexican candy before you leave. They rock!

Si Senor may I have more indeed.  

Came here for the first time a few weeks back and why have j been avoiding you do so long.  This place is delicious.  Nothing fancy, but if you know good Mexican food it should be simple ingredients down right and this place does just that. 

Great lunch menu if you swing in on your break.  And to top it off have a soppapilla with honey for dessert.  (Included with the lunch menu portions).

Great happy hour! Their margaritas are only a couple of bucks, so you can sip on a cocktail, eat chips and salsa, and visit with friends on a small budget. I really like the ground beef stuffed sopaipilla with hot green chili! We love this place!

Si Senor has been a local favorite of ours and the owner, Irene Castillo has also been a long-time friend so it was only natural to book Si Senor for our catering needs for our wedding on July 3, 2015. 

The catering was a hit! During cocktail hour Si Senor had set up stations including rolled tacos, bean and cheese chimichangas and chips with salsa. They were delicious and very full-filling. Our guests couldn't believe these were only the appetizers! When dinner approached, they served an authentic Mexican meal with delicious and spicy hatch green chile verde, enchildadas, rice and beans. It was served buffet style, but three servers maintained the meat serving station. 

Irene Castillo was really invested in making sure our guests were happy and full and our guests adored her! Once dinner was over, we, The Brides, went to thank the servers and they graciously stated they were thrilled to serve during such a wonderful moment. That comment meant a lot to us. The buffet set-up was also beautiful and very clean. 

We would highly recommend anyone to dine-in at Si Senor and meet Irene for your catering or delivery needs!

I have ordered many items off of the menu here and yet to be disappointed. The green sauce served with the chips is delicious if you like a kick! Enchiladas, chimis, taco salad is all tastee! It gets really busy at lunch, so be patient. During these busy times, we don't always get the same level of service. But Si Senor is still a go-to of ours when we have a taste for Mexican.

Bring that I'm from NM, I'll admit - I'm a little partial to Si Señor. However, that's only due to the fact that they nail the New Mexican food menu. Seeing as how they started out in Las Cruces, NM I'd expect nothing less than authentic New Mexican cuisine, and that's exactly what you get. 

The service is usually pretty good, I'd say the only downside is it's basically impossible to place a phone order. I've tried placing a call-in order about 5 times and was only successful once. They're always busy, which s a good thing, but I feel as though it has to deter some business when you literally have to drive there and place your to-go order in person, then wait for it to be prepared. 

All in all the food is excellent and worth waiting for, as our family comes here at least 2-3 times a month. Highly recommend their ground beef tacos, and enchilada-style (smothered) burritos. Kiddos usually enjoy a taco plate or bean and cheese burrito. Last, their sopapillas are a heavenly ending to your meal - pro tip: get the cinnamon and sugar ones all day everyday.

Thursday night, party of 10, family meeting out of town guests for dinner. Chips and salsa they give were pretty good although the server had to be asked to refill it. Half of the table had no silverware when the entrees arrived. They charge you for splitting an entree. The food was just ok. It was very disappointing that the tortillas were store bought and not homemade. I probably won't return. It definitely was not the authentic Mexican I was hoping to show my out of town guests.

We love Si Señor...It has the taste of home that my family craves! Their portions are great for the price, and to finish the meal with a fresh sopapilla... YUM!!! I especially appreciate the Zia symbol when you walk in, since I am from Las Cruces, and the big picture in the lobby of the Si Señor restraunt back home

This is a NEW MEXICAN restaurant and you can expect to actually get HOT red/green chili that rivals the best restaurants NM has to offer (and it's reasonably priced).  

Having lived in NM for 20 years, I'm extremely spoiled and want my Mexican food with the spice that you can only get from the NM grown Anaheim Green Chili's and Si Senor's has that in spades.  

It's very casual so you can feel comfortable sitting down to a meal after a hard day's work and the staff is always courteous & quick.  As soon as you sit down, you are munching on chips with 4 incredible salsa/dip choices.  It's always a little busy, but after eating there dozens of times I can only remember the service being a bit slow once (found out they were short staffed that night, so it was understandable).

My favorites -  the chile relleno & the hatch valley chile con carne ("Christmas Style" of course, with both red & green chile & an egg on top).  YUM!! 

My only warning - try not to over eat!  Just get the left over box and have some more another day as the free sopapillas for dessert are too good to pass up!

After living in NM for 10 years and moving to AZ 4 yrs ago I have been searching for authentic NM food. I had all but given up until I tried si señors . The relleno was perfection as well as the "hot" green chili and everything on my plate. And of course it would no be a NM dish without sopapillas...

Lived in Albuquerque for nearly 10 years, I'm always missing and craving the hatch green chili! They are very authentic and love my #3. Glad they finally added the Chili cheese fries, yummy goodness. Chili con carne with HOT green chili AhhhhMazing! Staff are always friendly. Always go there with the hubby for our fix!

The Best of Phoenix issue did not disappoint me or my daughter.  I got a delicious combination of spiciness.  The complimentary chips come with a variety of dips - salsa, bean dip, and some kind of creamy goodness.  The daughter was a little skeptical of all three options, so more for me.  I see other reviews referring to four dips, so maybe I was drunk off of over eating.  At the end, they give you a sapodilla to ensure that your belly is full and round.  The daughter was happy about that and I had to roll myself back to the car.

Ok so I guess I'm the odd one out here. The service was great the happy hour deal with imported beers for $2.50 was excellent but the food was just average. Well the chips were ok with the salsas, beans and sour cream but both of our meais were disappointing. It almost tasted like the food was premade and then heated up though I wouldn't accuse them of this it just sort of tasted that way. I had the veggie combo - the chile releno was mostly breading and kind of bland, the enchilada was decent but nothing that made it stand out and the taco was almost all lettuce with some beans but not much flavor.  They do charge for extra chips but to me for two people that's not a big deal since the portions are more than enough with one basket of chips. I will give it a second shot since everyone here says it's very good.

Recently moving from Las Cruces, NM where the only other Si Señor restaurant is (and absolutely loved going there (at least once a week)), I was extremely disappointed when I came to this location. I was really hoping I would be able to come here and enjoy some good New Mexican food that would remind me of home. First off, the overall ambience of the restaurant seemed dull and unauthentic. My girlfriend and I both ordered margaritas to start off. We were extremely unsatisfied with the size as well as the taste (it seemed as if they were made with cheap margarita mix had only a drop of tequila in them). The ones in Las Cruces were delicious and served in large, cold glass whereas these seemed to come in something equivalent to a sippy cup-sized plastic cup. Did I mention that it tasted like cheap margarita mix and no alcohol? They were rubbish. We also received the chips and salsa (which was mine and also my grandma's favorite part of coming to Si Señor), and my anticipation was totally shot down by the stale chips and tasteless assortment of salsas and dips. My grandma would be horrified if she had been there. She may be Filipino, but she knows what real Mexican food tastes like. Then there was the food. Bland, boring, room temperature and did not remind me of home. If Chef Ramsey was there, I can almost guarantee he would be extremely unsatisfied and then make a scene. We also received sopapillas at the end of our meal and those were as well bland and room temperature and also stale. In conclusion, I was very unsatisfied with my visit to this Si Señor location. If I'm not mistaken, a husband and wife own this chain, so my message to the manager of this restaurant, you've been away from New Mexico for too long and have no bloody idea what you're doing. Step it up and provide the citizens of Maricopa county with some delicious, warm and enjoyable New Mexican Cuisine. 
P.S. Your margaritas are pathetic and you need to step those up as well.

I'm have become so disappointed in Si Señor. Being from New Mexico, I sought this restaurant several years ago. The food was everything I had hoped for...true New Mexico cuisine. I learned that the original owners no longer operate the restaurant. Not sure where the new owners are from, but they've abandoned the wonderful New Mexican recipes for yet another boring, generic version of the same ol' same ol', that plagues the Phoenix area.
The green sauce has none of that "Hatch" flavor that people used to drive miles for. And the red Chile is so overburdened with flour, that is a bit like eating Chile flavored paste.
I am so sad that the quality has really tanked here.
Won't make the 30 mile drive again.

The ONLY place to get good Mexican food in Phoenix. Born and raised in southern New Mexico, near the original si senor! The food is always amazing at this place and the staff is friendly. Trust me, try this and you will not be sorry!

The food is is very spicy hot so if you like to feel the burn going in and later than this is a good place. The problems I have with it are the way you get nickle and dimed for extra chips, drink refills, etc. The place is clean and service is generally good.

We have been going here for the past few years.  My other half is a New Mexican native and we have always enjoyed going here since our first time.  It can be a bit tricky finding good New Mexican food here, there is really only one other place we know of so far.  On our last visit, we noticed how stingy they where with the chips and salsa, we always really enjoy that, but there was barely more than a tablespoon of each, barely enough to dip.  We both ordered the taco plate, one of our favorites.  The taco shell/tortillas have shrunk to a size between a normal taco size and a street taco size for the same price.  They were also cold, except for the usual super hot plate with beans and rice.  Kind of disappointing as it was a favorite place.  Also, it is easy to say that my other half is a bean expert, making the best beans I have ever had and been eating them since he was a baby.  He told me the beans were canned, and that they weren't before here.  Why have they gone so cheap all of a sudden?  Very sad, not sure if and when we will go back if there are better options.

I really enjoy this place. The food is good (not excellent) and they give you plenty of it. The prices are reasonable. Everything I have tried has been spicy but not to the point of discomfort. Mexican is my favorite so I am somewhat of a critic however, the warm sopapillas with honey are worth the trip alone. I will definitely return.

Great service abd great food, pretty awesome you hey so many dips with your chips and a free dessert at the end:) will definitely come back. I had the green Chille carne asada burrito abd a red cheese enchilada so yummy. Couldn't finish but my left overs will be amazing

I LOVE mexican food!!  I am always looking for another good spot to feed my addiction.  I am happy to say I found one that is always just a couple of miles from my house!!  I love the atmosphere here.  I went in for lunch and the place is bright and cheery.  I thought the tables and the chairs were so cute.  The chairs had sunflowers carved on them and painted a sunny yellow.  So cheery!!  

My server brought me a basket of chips and four.....yes four dips!!  The traditional red salsa, a sour cream and jalapeno dip, a bean dip with bits of chorizo in it, and a spicy green salsa that had tons of flavor!!  I love tortilla chips and these were fresh and hot!  The perfect chip in my opinion.  My server told me that they have a tortilla factory in New Mexico and they get the tortillas fresh a couple of times a week to make their own chips.  YUM!!!  They have a lunch special every day and my day was Sopapillas.  They give you a choice of red or green sauce, I chose red cause, yes, I am a wimp.  I can't take a lot of heat.  It was yummy and saucy.  The plate came with two delicious sopapillas filled with ground beef and generous portions of rice and beans.  My only complaint was the filling.....it needed something, maybe some green chiles or some other thing to spice it up just a bit.  They were good, just a bit bland.  The rice and beans were great!  The rice was nice and fluffy and the beans were topped with lots of cheese.  And the other amazing part was that they give you a sopapilla for dessert too!!  I got a cinnamon sugar one and it was heavenly.  I thought I would only eat a bite cause I was so full but I ended up eating the whole thing!!  

I will defintly be going back to Si Senor!!  The food was great, service was fast and friendly and I have a feeling I will be craving those chips and dips again soon!!!
So delicious and on the less expensive side. Just try and save room for desert....I always forget it comes with the meal.

Good food.  The sopapillas are an excellent addiction, especially the cinnamon sugar ones, and are the reason for the four stars.  The mildest of the three levels of chili is mild enough even for pasty white boring me, yet still delicious and flavorful.  The hotest chilis satisfieds my coworkers with even the most burned-out of tastebuds.  Portions are plentiful and dinner under $10 is quite doable.

Had lunch here.  7.50$ lunch special for a burrito, rice and beans.  Came with a free dessert.
Food was pretty decent, and plentiful for the price.
Their salsa is a little bland.

I love this place, I've been going since my family told me about it!!  This is some good New Mexico Mexican food!  Service is always fast and wonderful - their much special is available even on the weekends and the perfect portion!

Best New Mexican Green Chile based meal in town. If I had this place in my town I'd be here twice a month.   Grab your favorite person and take them here now. 

Great food. Try the Flautas and Chile Rellenos.

Casual ambiance that has an open and comfortable feel.

Good service that makes you feel welcome.
My most favorite New Mexican place. I love the chips and dips and the large dinner portions. The taco are awesome. I also love the free desert. Great.

Fire new mexican food! All the sauces were seasoned perfectly and super flavorful. The Chile relleno was money. Slightly crispy on the outside. The sour creme has green chillies in it and it's ridiculous. Good size potuons, the rice was tasty and the beans were seasoned just right  the sopapilla was fluffy and airy. Service was good. Left happy. This is a gem.

So, this mexican restaurant is just like any other mexican restaurant in the valley. If you like the same ol', same ol' kind of Mexican food then you'll like this place. On the other hand I like the more modern style mexican restaurants myself. One thing that really got me and irritated the heck out of me about this place is serving the food out of a plastic tray. I feel like I'm back in Junior High School. I want real plates, round plates, I prefer squared plates but it doesn't really matter as long as they are actual plates. In conclusion, I will probably never go to this restaurant ever again. If I wanted to be served food in this manner, I would go to "Filiberto's" and get me a "number1" combo plate and then proceed to pour it into my dog dish and then eat it (save some money this way).

Being a native New Mexican who has searched high and low throughout the Phoenix Valley for traditional New Mexican food, this was a very big blessing. Not only authentic chile, but a familiar face and taste I've enjoyed from Las Cruces and Farmington, NM. REAL Hatch green chile. Real, actual sopapillas AND a photo of the original restaurant from the home of my college, NMSU in Las Cruces... I'll be back for sure. Thank you for existing, now never close!
Enjoyed the red chile pork. Tender and melt in your mouth good. The rice and beans also tasted freshly made  and were tasty. Service was great, restaurant was clean and is modern.

I love the New Mexican food, as it is sometimes hard to find out here in Phoenix since moving from New Mexico. This place does not disappoint and keeps me coming back. 

The complimentary chips and dip variety is great, followed by a huge portioned meal, and free soppapias! What more can you ask for? They offer three levels of spiciness with most entrees. My favorite is the hot green hatch, they are spicy and very flavorful! Try the house made raspberry tea.

Being from New Mexico, I need a taste of home every once in a while, and this place satisfies that craving. I used to go to the Original Si Señor in Las Cruces for lunch and happy hour, and I'm happy to see the same great food happy hour here in Chandler. Best chips and salsa and sopapillas in town!
Love it! Being from New Mexico, this food was like home away from home!  They had the choice of mild or spicy, but I of course went with hot! Leaving with tingling lips! Perfect!

Decided the give this place another chances and is so disappointed that I did. There service is horrendous. Waited forever the get out order taken. When we asked about the menue the waitress has absolutely no knowledge about the food. When she dropped the food off she forgot to give us silverware.  Iv know been sitting here for over 20min haven't even touched my plate becasue I really don't feel like eating with my hands. When she finally did come back she was rude and sarcastic. So know I just wasted over $20 bucks for a lousy mushy lasty looking sopapillas or what ever it is. The meet looks lie dog food. The only good this here is there margaritas and there dip. I am Beyond disappointed. Don't come here. I know I won't

This is a little taste of heaven. Good New Mexico Mexican cuisine is hard to find in AZ, but Si Senor has got you covered. The green chile is real Hatch chile and it's delicious. The red chile is my favorite but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

I have loved this restaurant for years but the last two times have been beyond disappointing. It took almost ten minutes to get drink/chips. The waitress only had appeared to have 4 tables to tend to but really slow. She left our table w our food on cart to give another table their drinks. The tacos were soggy on one side. We were so irritated that we skipped the sopapiilas but then had to wait to get the check.. I think that's the last time we are going there.

So me and my buddy hit this spot up on a Saturday night. It has a nice feel to it, good music playing, nice lighting, tv's with sports on. The staff is friendly enough, and the food came quickly and was deliciously hot and melty. They start you off with chips and salsa which is actually 4 separate dipping sauces including beans. My only complaint is I ordered the chimichanga plate enchilada style and was expecting a larger meal. Tasted good but a little small. I think I just ordered the wrong thing. My buddy got the green chili platter and was huge and looked awesome.  Then they top it off with fresh hot sopappias (get them covered in cinnamon. ...trust me lol). Plan on going back for a combo plate or the green chili burro looked great.  Happy hogging lol

Had to write a review for Si Sensor Restaurant because I absolutely LOVED THE CUSTOMER SERVICE I received from the Catering Manager Yolanda! I was in search of a Mexican restaurant that caters tacos for a casual work dinner we hosted at my boss's house in the Gilbert area. After researching several competitors I chose Si Senor based on their amazing reviews on Yelp, selection of their CATERING menu, great prices, and location. I happen to reach out to Yolanda during her day off and while she was away from the office and she had no issues taking down my order. She gave me a call later that day after she returned to the restaurant to give me an exact price. Definitely appreciated her taking time from her off day to go back to work and take care of my order.Yolanda even called the day before to confirm my order.

Our order consisted of 2 chicken taco trays, 2 beef taco trays (12 tacos in each tray), 1.5 dozen of sopapillas, 1 tray of beans, 1 tray of salsa, 1 tray of tortilla chips, and 12 oz salsa red, green, and white salsa. Our order was more than enough to feed our party of 16 adults. The tacos were crunchy, but not too greasy. Meat, rice and beans were tasty. Sopapillas were as good as everyone raves about. My favorite was the WHITE SALSA. It was the right amount of spiciness that I LOVE!  I received no complaints about the food. Everyone absolutely loved everything!

Upon arrival, our order was ready, packaged, and loaded on a cart ready to transfer into our car. Yolanda was at the front desk and greeted us. She was so friendly and welcoming. THANK YOU AGAIN YOLANDA! It was a pleasure doing business with you and your staff!

After coming here for more than 10 years and often times weekly I must say that I am disappointed with the lack of consistency of their chips/salsa. The chips are grease laden and hard to eat. However we notice that other tables have different types of chips. Why the difference? Confused to say the least. We are pleased with the waitress and entrees. Not sure about consistently returning.....

Still searching for that inexpensive Mexican restaurant with decent flavor.  So I decided to stop in and try their Chili Meat Burrito with pork and red sauce for lunch.  First off they bring pretty good chips and 4 different sauces, not a bad start.  The burrito was of normal size with a portion of refried beans and rice.  Overall the meal was OK, enough so that I will venture back and try a different dish.  Not a bad lunch for $8.13...worth giving it a shot!

I love everything here, but what makes Si Senor really stand out?

* Fantastic hot green chile.
* Chips with 4 great tasting dips.
* Sopapillas coated with cinnamon & sugar.

It can get very crowded at lunch.  The place opens at 10:30am.  Choose your arrival time wisely.

Omg!  This was truly a find. I came upon this place by accident and feel blessed to have found it. As a traveling salesperson I have to grab and go. While waiting for my appointment I sat down to eat here. The Chile Relleno with green sauce was to die for. I would have licked the plate if it was proper. The price was so reasonable and it came with rice and refried beans. The complimentary tortilla chips came with 4 different sauces. I am now stuffed. To top it off, I feel like I was awarded a sopadilla for desert. Next time I am in Arizona, this is my go to place.

Being from New Mexico I thought id go here and have some amazing Green and Red Chile dishes. Not so much. I spent 14yrs in New Mexico and know New Mexican food very well. This is a fairly bad knockoff of what New Mexican food is. 

Si Senor is a bland chain in New Mexico that is reaching to capture other markets apparently. This is no Los Cuates!

We had about a group of 20 celebrating early Cinco de Mayo. This is a great place for large groups. They have a few separate dining areas.  

I had the chicken chimichanga with green chile sauce plate. The potion size was decent.  I thought the green chile sauce just wasn't enough on the chimichange. 
No sour cream and guac came with the plate. I don't mind paying for them if the server offered. It wouldn't be a Cinco de Mayo celebration without margaritas. The ladies ordered strawberry and classic frozen margaritas while the boys got beers. If you are a light weight with the alcohol consider sharing the margarita.    

At least they still give complimentary chips & salsa plus sopapilla for dessert.  They bring you both sopapilla in plain and cinnamon sugar.  Made hot and fresh!  It's messy, but so worth it!
If you like frog meat then you'll want to eat here because the food looks and tastes disgusting the food is served on a platter like a dog bowls so gross I would never eat here
I absolutely love this place. Free chips and salsa partnered with very good Mexican food. Always a 10.

I go here for their chips and dips. Their green chili dip is out of this world amazing. I would order it by the gallon if I could. The taco salad is good, and comes with sour cream and guac, without being an additional charge. The enchiladas and flauta plates meet expectations. They serve a number of new mexican style hatch green chili plates. A favorite of mine. Avoid on Friday and Saturday nights, the line and wait is just ridiculous. It's not the best mexican restaurant I have ever been to, but few restaurants in the area have a variety of green chili dishes, let alone good ones. So for this, I give them 5 stars.

Thank goodness for Las Cruces bringing the best Mexican food to the valley.  I lived in Las Cruces and I'm telling you they have THE best Mexican restaurants ever.  Si Señor in Cruces is not even one of the best ones, but it's way better than anything I've had living 10 years in Albuquerque.

From the signage in the front, to the moment I walked in the door, it looked like the one at "home".  Just like I remember it.  Love the picture right in the front with the Organ mountains in the background.  Ok, ok, enough reminiscing, onto the food.  I loved the salsas.  Haven't had the green chile salsa in a while, but it was yummy.  The red was hot, a good hot.  I ordered a combo and everything was just delicious.  I honestly judge a true Mexican restaurant by their rice.  It's been a while since I've had some decent rice and this one was very tasty.  I wish there had been more on the plate. And lastly, the sugary sopas were the icing on the cake.  Finger licking good!

So glad this place is here, a bit of a drive, but totally worth it to me to make me feel like I have something just like home.
I  loved this place!  Their green chili is super spicy. Love it! $1 magaritas rock. The atmosphere is perfect.  I was pleasantly surprised.  I will go back many times.

So my second visit was not as pleasurable as the first. The food lacks the flavor that I am looking for. New Mexican food at its finest. Not as spicy as some other places but more flavor. The green chili has a nice zip to it but is also packed with tons of texture and flavor. The pork is seasoned well and super tender. Beans and rice were good, too. A cinnamon sugar sopapilla to top it off is a nice touch. Chips come with cream, beans, and green and red salsa. Interior transports you to New Mexico and staff is great.

When I lived in Phoenix, I usually prowled around North Phoenix, Tempe and Scottsdale; avoiding venturing anywhere south of Broadway, west of 7th Avenue and east of Alma School. Yes, I admit it...I was a North Phoenix Snob......but I have reformed my ways and on a recent trip back to the desert, a group of friends suggested Si Senor for a great "New Mexico style" Mexican meal.  All I can say is Booyah!!! Si Senor (despite the cheesy name) delivered respectably as promised. 

I had the sopapilla stuffed with beef and covered with a not too spicy red chile sauce, and my friends all got the sampler platter, or as they referred to it, the "pig platter". Their description would prove to be accurate and it was a sight to behold...three strapping men who could NOT finish everything on  their plates. For desert we had cinnamon and sugar dusted sopapillas (okay, I had them since everyone else was wallowing around in their chairs miserably) to which I added copious amounts of honey, of course.

I would have given five stars here, but according to my local piglets, Si Senor has raised their prices recently, and now charges for refills of chips and salsa. In my book, bottomless chips/salsa are a requirement  for any Mexican restaurant.

Si Senors is the best in the West when looking for New Mexican food!!  They have quick service, good chips and salsa, great dishes and free sopapillas for after your meal.  They can be a little stingy on chips as it is noted that they charge for another serving....so ask ahead.

No Señor !!!!!

Forget the dusty fake plants, out of date decor, and unappetizing atmosphere - some of that could be considered old school if the food was legit.  

Unfortunately the food is far worse than the decor.  The food is delivered to your table on a dirty bus cart . . . Mmmmmm

The pork plate literally looks like Alpo.   Low quality meat slathered in disgusting gravy.  I picture a kitchen worker with a cigarette dangling from their mouth slopping the portions on to the plates.  The presentation is as disgusting as the food as the decor . . . 

The fajita salad might be the saddest, most remedial, uncaring dish I have ever seen.  When my girlfriend let the server know the chicken was tough and chewy (as if it had been re used) she replied, "it's gross isn't it?"    I almost fell out of my chair .

The  greasy tacos in front of me instantly became even more unappetizing . . . That comment aside, the tacos were disgusting enough are their own. 

I sat there looking at the disgusting food and surroundings and really questioned how they stay in business (and even more so why I was still sitting there)

Their ingredients are the lowest grade I've ever seen in a restaurant , and the presentation is enough to make you lose your appetite.  It is truly a disgusting experience.   

No Señor !!!!
My favorite place hands down to eat red chili! The green is good but extremely spicy.

Woooo Hoooooo HOT!  If you are a fan of New Mexico style heat this is the place for you.  Be careful when you dive into the dipping sauces they offer with the chips, looks can be deceiving.  My missing star is due to the fact that I think it would be nice for the servers to give you a heads up on the heat, especially when there are kids at the table.

I have the fajitas when we go and my honey has the chicken enchiladas.  We've yet to be disappointed.  At the end of your meal they bring you warm sopappillas! (sp) that are a perfect finish.  I'd recommend trying Si Senor's if your in the Chandler area.

Authentic New Mexican food right down to the Question! .... Red or Green,? ( chile... I am definitely a green fan and si senor does not disappoint) The homemade chips ( thin and warm when served with not 1 or 2 but 4 salsas green white brown, bean & red! The white is unique and tasty. Fully echo other  yelper' s comments about excellent service. My new favorite in Phoenix. Nice East valley location too! Better than los dos Molinos! Although not as hot

To me New Mexican cuisine means heat and this place does it right. Be prepared when they bring you your complimentary chips and salsa because it will set the mode for the rest of your meal. If you thinks its hot, then go easy on the rest. I don't want to turn you away, it's not going to burn your tongue off. Put it to you this way, the chips and salsa comes with three different flavors of salsa. If they put that much effort into just the complimentary salsa, they put enough care into the rest of your food too.

Been patronizing this restaurant since we moved to Chandler in 2002.  One of the finest southwest cuisine restaurants in the country in my opinion.  Great menu, good service and absolutely consistent throughout the last 12 years.

Si Señor is definitely my absolute favorite Mexican restaurant... By far. I'm from New Mexico and ever since moving to Arizona, I hadn't found any great Mexican food... Until this place. I was raised on Mexican food and I can tell you that Si Señor is completely authentic New Mexican cuisine. I love getting the combination plate (#1). That way you get a bit of everything. And don't even get me started on the happy hour margaritas... But the chips and 4 different salsas are the best part!! I'll see you soon Si Señor!

Very good,authentic Mexican food. Happy hour margaritas are only 2.50, they give you a variety of homemade chili sauces to go with your chips and to finish your meal you get complementary soppias. Very yummy!

You know you are in the right place when It is bustling with people on just a random Monday evening. 

The menu has an ample assortment of dinners and combination platters, it made it really hard to finally pick a plate. Everyone in my party was raving about their dinners, all the food was top notch. Plus I really enjoyed the different choices of sauces to use on the enchiladas and different items. The margaritas were also dangerously good.

 I may have found a new favorite Mexican food place in Arizona.

Si senor is one of my "go to" Mexican food restauarants. I love the chips and they serve them with green sauce, red salsa, a sour cream spicy dip,and beans. They are all great and the green definitely has a hot kick. 

I like their food. I had stuffed sopapillas with shredded beef. I would like to have had more flavor in the beef but Ming it with the green sauce helps. I do love their rice and I don't often find a place that has good Mexican rice. Friends had the flauta plate, a tamale, tacos and enchiladas. Everybody was quite pleased with their lunch. 

Sopapillas for dessert are great. I grew up in New Mexico where most Mexican food restaurants serve them for Dessert. They were light and flaky.

Fantastic New Mexican cuisine, the best that I have had.  We've always been seated pretty much right away and the restaurant is nice and large and can accommodate big parties.  The ambiance is nothing special but is clean and comfortable.  The food is where its at though.

As soon as you sit down they bring out free chips and four different salsas.  The green spicy salsa and the creamy white salsa are hands down my favorite but the red and the bean dip are both good too.  They will charge for extra chips and salsa which is a bit of a bummer and their chips could be fresher and thinner in my opinion.

Make sure you try the hatch chile while you are here.  Their pork chile verde is very good, their flour tortillas are great and the burritos are not to be missed.  Their portions are huge and easily shareable but the prices are also very reasonable.  To top it off you finish the meal with plain or cinnamon sopapillas which are a real treat.  Margaritas are a little weak so make special requests if you don't like watered down drinks.  Otherwise a great place!

Si Senor is my favorite Mexican food restaurant. I love that you get four different dips with the chips and all four are wonderful. You can't get anything like the sour cream salsa at any other restaurant. I have liked every meal that I have tried. The rice is cooked  well and has the perfect spices. In addition to the amazing meal, you get a sopapilla at the end. The service has always been kind and attentive. My husband and I go at least once a month.

Holy giant portions!  My boyfriend and I split a plate and were still stuffed.  I ordered the combo plate #1 which came with Rolled cheese enchilada, tamale, relleno, taco, 
Hatch Valley chile con carne smothered with your choice of chile.  I am a wimp so I did not choose the hot chile.  Really good, except the taco...this was totally a ground beef taco...yucky...but the rest of the food on the plate made up for that taco.  They do charge 2.95 for sharing but it is worth it because I don't see how anyone could finish a plate on their own.  They have such an assortment of flavors with their chips and salsa.  It comes with bean dip, green salsa, red salsa and a ranch type of dip.  All were quite tasty.  The best part is that the meal comes with sopapillas!  YUMMY.  They were delish.  They just need to get rid of that ground beef taco and replace that with some good ol shredded beef, that was the only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars.

Ordered a beer & they salted the glass without asking. Ordered carne asada tacos... Each one had less than an ounce of meat & the tortilla was hard (not fried). Salsa was decent. Service was acceptable. I'll look elsewhere for tacos.

Went for lunch yesterday.....the reviews we right on, things were spicy, just the way I like it. It was funny as I looked around the dining room folks were sniffing from runny noses, awesome! Its the first time I ever had hot (temperature wise) dipping sauces for my chips...I'm not complaining just different. I like them all but after munching on them for about 15 minutes the red was in the lead followed closely by green hatch(hottest). Keep in mind this appetizer of chips and dips has the power to fill you up. My main entree with the Deluxe combination platter...it was too much food especially after over doing it on the chips/dips. The star for me was the red chili con carne. Solid rice and re-fried beans.
I didn't care for the tamale as much and the cheese enchilada was just taking up space.
Now that I know what its all about I can be more selective when I go back.
My husband and I ate here once, that was enough. Very Americanized, bland, "Mexican" food. Very heavy on the cheese. I wasn't impressed.

Great food! I always order cheese enchiladas with the spicy green sauce.  You can't go wrong with them.  Beware of the salsa quartet...it's addicting! I honestly can't pick a favorite. I'm tempted to order extra cinnamon sugar sopapillas at the end of the meal!

Si Seor is the best Mexican food Chandler has to offer, from what I've tried.  The vegetarian combination is the best!  They offer quite a few combination platters to choose from, or you can get a plate of just your favorites.  I bring all of my out-of-town visitors to this restaurant, pushing the sangria and combinations to all who dine with me.  Their horchata is also quite tasty, and it's a nice compliment to the dishes with the red sauce.  The sopapilla is a perfect ending, and I'm happy to report that they also include them with take-out orders.  Very good value for your money!

Ambience is good 4 of 5, appetizer chips and salsa was good can be better, comes with four dipping bean, salsa, ranch & chilli salsa 3 of 5. Main course was good can be better, we ordered fajitas, and burritos the veggies were over cooked also the qty was less, tortilla were dry and not fresh guacamole was not so fresh and okay in taste. Service was poor as they took 10min to get me beans after serving fajitas also they served my pepsi 5 min before ending my dinner that too  after two reminders. Avg price per person was 15$ not value for money considering the qty and service. I am not sure how it got best review on Yelp!!!

Love this place. Nice restaurant to dine solo or bring the family. It is typical Sonoran fare with New Mexico dishes and hatch chiles also on the menu. 
Terrific bean dip with your chips, along with 3 other dips.

If you've eaten red chile, chile con colorado, chile con carne, etc. at other places in the valley, try the Red chile con carne here. Excellent flavor and made with pork, not beef.

As to the question does Si Senor merit being a "regular stop" on the list? Having been to most Mexican restaurants in the valley at least once, Si Senor is easily better than the second rate fare dished out at east valley Garcia's, Serrano's, etc. and it's a nice atmosphere. Give it a go, no disappointments here.
This restaurant was recommended from an Offer Up seller as we are not familiar with the area.   Fantastic service.  Each bite was delicious and I was completely satisfied and happy about our dinner!

I drive all the way from Glendale just to eat here! And to be honest, their red Chile enchiladas are so good I'd travel all the way to Las Cruces, NM to eat at the original restaurant (if this one didn't exist). Everything from the free assortment of salsa to the free sopapillas for dessert is amazing!!!! Only two complaints, if you go on a weekend expect to wait around 30 minutes to be seated, and it is extremely humid and hot in the restaurant. I happened to be seated by the thermostat and it said it was 85 degrees in there the whole time. If the food wasn't so good this would be unacceptable!
We are from Las Cruces and we are so happy to have Si Senor New Mexico Cuisine in Chandler. This is our favorite place.

We tried Si Senor in our recent visit to Arizona, and overall, we liked it.  First, they brought out chips (1st basket is free) for appetizers with four things to dip them into, two chile sauces, beans, and a sour cream based one.  They were all yummy!  I ordered the Si Senor Combo plate which came with an enchilada, a chile relleno, a taco, and a tamale, all smothered under their green chile sauce.  I subbed the tamale for taco, and they were very accommodating.  The dish, overall, was good.  I would've liked the taco to be carne asada instead of ground beef, but it was still okay.  And for desert, our meal included sopapillas which was tasty.  Will probably try Si Senor again when we are back in AZ.

Overall, good food, okay service, okay prices.

A significant change from my previous 5 star review, and that is about the chips and salsa that I like so much.  Used to be served with 4 different kinds of dips 1. red salsa 2.  green chilli salsa 3.  sour cream, milk and jalapenos concoction 4.  warm refried beans in a scalloped clear plastic ice cream cup.  

Well today April 23, 2018, I went, and the restaurant changed the more generous and deeper plastic ice cream cup to put the chip dips in, to something like a shallow round ash tray, with only 2 tablespoons of salsa, and two tablespoons of the rest of the listed items.  The "ashtray" is filled only half full, which is two tablespoons.  Barely enough to cover the bottom, which means it isn't deep enough for dipping, except the mere corners and edges of your chip.  The chip is bigger than the little "ash tray".  Your two tablespoons of salsa in the crock are gone with 2 chips, if you ask for a spoon to help spoon the salsa onto your chip, like I did.  So your dips get eaten real fast.  I asked for more, but after asking several times for more, cos remember I said each crock only takes care of two chips.  

Annoying to have to look for our server again and again to bring us more salsa, after eating only two chips.  My friend said to me,  "They are so stingy with the salsa".  I wanted to put more salsa on my chili relleno and asked for more, but then my friend ate what server brought for my chili relleno, so when I asked for another one, my server said she was gonna have to charge me.  She said many people don't even eat the salsa, so it all goes to waste.  That is why they went to serving so little, now, and we could always ask for more.   I said "Well I'm Not PAYING EXTRA, you only give 2 tablespoons". 

  I agree with the waste, but two tablespoons so shallow you cannot even "dip", is on the other extreme.  My eating buddy was already writing her Google review while we were eating, and mentioning in her review that she was eating with a Yelp Eliter.  When she told the server that we were writing reviews, the server was really much nicer, and brought me another crock of salsa that she filled to the brim, instead of another 2 tablespoons.  When I saw the difference in the amount in the crock this time (to the brim), she remarked acknowledgement that she hand ladled the salsa and deliberately filled it to the brim (meaning 4 tablespoons instead of 2).  

I did not waste anything short of licking the little "ashtrays" before I left.   I even asked to take home the two tablespoons of salsa that was left in that ashtray , cos I had to hurry off to my dental appt.  Valerie our server looked at me with dismay and almost shock, when I said I wanted to take home the little bit of salsa and leftover chips, but said she nothing, and got me the container and takeout paper bag for the chips.  I guess most people who leave it there to be thrown away, but hey, I just really enjoyed it at 8 pm tonight, at home.  

I think the lunch special for $7.95 is good value, includes drink, entree, the chips and dips, and sopapilla.  When I paid at the cash register, I mentioned to the cash register lady, that there is only 2 tablespoons of salsa in that ashtray, can't even dip but little edge or corner of your chip.  She said, "I told her not to charge you for the salsa."

 Yes, well, thank you.  See you again when I have another dental appt (dental office is at Country Club N. of Elliot).

The service was great and fast! The chips brought out were of great quality, none of that store bought tortilla chips I see all the time! Four dips including salsa were also free. 
I ordered the chicken fajita plate thinking it was a little pricey, but nope! I got so much food with it I asked for a box right when the waitress set the food down. Chicken was good, veggies were awesome and the tortillas served were warm. Only thing I wish was that I got a little more variety of veggies, I only saw bell peppers and onion. 
I didn't get the sopapilla dish but the table next to ours did and DAMN did it look good!! Can't wait to try it.

I brought some friends from NM and they totally loved it. Corina was our server and she was awesome! This is a Friday night at 7 pm and she was super busy yet treated us like we were her only table. The chips and salsa also came with green chile, beans and sour cream sauce. So delicious. I had stuffed sopapillas with medium red chile. They were so good, with ground beef, red chile and rice and beans. I think they could've used some fresh lettuce but were fantastic nonetheless. Mom had the same with spicy green chile and absolutely ate her entire plate. My friend had a combo plate with a flauta, taco and enchilada. She loved all of it smothered in green chile. Nothing special about the margs but we really loved the food.

Hands down best Mexican food in the valley. I literally live in Peoria and make the drive here just for the food. I crave it in a daily basis. Not to mention the green chili is out of this world! You can get mild or hot and of course being from New Mexico I get the hot. It does not disappoint. 
The service is always amazing and the food is always great. I love the chips and salsa they bring before the food with four choices of dips for the chips. I always seem to overeat when I come here because it is addicting! I literally eat till I am sick! It is worth the drive and if you haven't eaten here you have to do it ASAP!

So good! Amazing hot and mild green chili! Chips are awesome and meal comes with four different salsas and free sopapillas! Tip: order burritos ala carte plenty of food and save you half the price of the full meal!
I love coming to Si Señor we live Queen Creek it's worth the drive The pork red chili is the best in town and margaritas wow
Best Mexican food in the world.  We live in CO and make it a point to stop at Si Señor every time we visit AZ.
Do not order anything chicken or carne. The worst meat I've ever had. Waitress was great the food was pretty bland but chips were good.

Just reading some of the other reviews and l am laughing my butt off.
People complaining about the sangria, or comparing to old Town San Diego!!
Listen up snowflakes....
This is real food, made by real people.
My wife and I are older, Sun lakes types, and are always greeted and treated very hospitably by everyone here!! Food is fresh, hot and delicious. Not phony Mexican" gourmet" style. Down home style.
Maybe best food value in Phoenix area.
Example:
Start with complimentary chips and 4 dips!!!!
I usually get the #1 combo which has a beef taco, tamale, chili relleno ( the Best), enchilada, green chili with pork , beans  and rice!!!
I take one half home for tomorrows  breakfast.
Then they bring you a hot sopapilla for dessert.
Like I said, great service, tasty food, good value.
Just don't be a miserable snowflake and you'll probably enjoy it as well.

My coworker suggested this place and I'll say the food is decent, but the extras are what keeps me coming back. As soon as you sit down they give you hot chips with 4 different dipping sauces, which are all spicy and delicious! A bean dip, salsa, green chili salsa, and this jalapeño sour cream dip that is crazy addicting. We usually eat two baskets of chips! We got the chimichanga plate and the delux plate for dinner. The chimichanga is definitely smaller than a lot of other places that serves them and they don't give you a side of or put any lettuce or tomato or sour cream for the chimi. Everything you order they give you the option to smother with red sauce, green sauce, or a spicier green sauce. For the price I think the portions are a bit small. After dinner, they give you sopapillas which are warm and cinnamon sugary and so delicious when you drizzle honey over it! The service there has always been great and the restaurant is always packed. Overall it's pretty good for Mexican food and the extras just make it better!

No Senor is right!
I dont know what's up with all those 5 star reviews? These people must have never been to Old Town, San Diego.
The chili relliano was heavily dredged in four and was uneatable.
The sangria was way too sweet, I did not even drink it. I am sure Thunderbird tastes better than that! It was not homemade and came out of a cheap bottle and for $7.50/glass?! Wow! What a joke and a rip off!
When I saw the cart, I thought they were clearing the plates off the tables.
The rice came out of a bag and the beans came out of a can.
I am glad I did not order any meat, I bet that would really have been Alpo!
Salsas were not authentic Mexican.
Service was good.
There were all these plaques on the wall saying voted best Mexican food in Chandler.
If that's the best Chandler has to offer, then I am not returning to that town!

The service was friendly, efficient and fast.  

A basket of chips was brought to the table that had four dips.  One was sour cream mixed with jalapenos and green chile (yum), one was refried beans made with bacon and sausage (I believe - don't quote me on it because I don't eat pork), one was a red salsa and one was a green salsa.  I loved the red salsa!  Yum!

The food was really quite delicious, though definitely not low-calorie, and came in huge portions.

I particularly liked the red sauce that came on my shredded beef burrito.  I typically prefer the green chile sauce, but the green chiles here were not very spicy (even though I was asked if I wanted hot or mild).  

I even liked the sopapillas, which I had served with cinnamon, sugar and honey.  They were very light - almost like zeppoles, but a little more crisp.  

I will definitely come here again, hopefully for happy hour!
Great service and great food will definitely come here again the sopapillas meal was delicious and also the cheese enchilada .....
